Allāhummaḥfaẓnī min bayni yadayya, wa min khalfī. wa `an yamīnī, wa `an shimālī. wa min fawqī. wa a`ūdhu bi`aẓamatika an 'ughtāla min taḥtī.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in this world and the next. 

O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in my religion, in my worldly affairs, in my family and in my wealth. 

O Allah, conceal my secrets and preserve me from anguish. 

O Allah, guard me from what is in front of me and behind me, from my left, and from my right, and from above me. I seek refuge in Your Greatness from being struck down from beneath me.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sahih Ibn Majah 2/332 and Abu Dawud. Hisnul Muslim 84

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #12
duas.ar_dua:
اللّهُـمَّ عالِـمَ الغَـيْبِ وَالشّـهادَةِ فاطِـرَ السّماواتِ وَالأرْضِ رَبَّ كـلِّ شَـيءٍ وَمَليـكَه 

 أَشْهَـدُ أَنْ لا إِلـهَ إِلاّ أَنْت  

أَعـوذُ بِكَ مِن شَـرِّ نَفْسـي وَمِن شَـرِّ الشَّيْـطانِ وَشِـرْكِه  وَأَنْ أَقْتَـرِفَ عَلـى نَفْسـي سوءاً أَوْ أَجُـرَّهُ إِلـى مُسْـلِم
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma `ālima ‘l-ghaybi wash-shahādahfātir as-samāwāti wa ‘l'arḍ. Rabba kulli shay'in wa malīkah. 

ash-hadu an lā ilāha illā ant. 

a`ūdhu bika min sharri nafsī. wa min sharrish-shayṭāni wa shirkih. wa an aqtarifa `alā nafsī sū'an, aw ajurrahu ilā Muslim.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the evident, Maker of the heavens and the earth, Lord of everything and its Possessor, 

I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. 

I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul, and from the evil of Satan and his helpers.(I seek refuge in You) from bringing evil upon my soul and from harming any Muslim.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/142 and AbuDawud. Hisnul Muslim 85

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #13
duas.ar_dua: بِسـمِ اللهِ الذي لا يَضُـرُّ مَعَ اسمِـهِ شَيءٌ في الأرْضِ وَلا في السّمـاءِ وَهـوَ السّمـيعُ العَلـيم . (ثلاث مرات)
duas.transliteration: Bismillāhi ‘l-ladhī lā yaḍurru ma`a-smihishay'un fil-'arḍi wa lā fis-samā'wa huwas-Samī `ul-`Alīm.
duas.en_translation: In the Name of Allah, Who with His Name nothing can cause harm in the earth nor in the heavens, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. (Recite three times in Arabic).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Whoever recites it three times in the morning will not be afflicted by any calamity before evening, and whoever recites it three times in the evening will not be overtaken by any calamity before morning. Abu Dawud 4/323, At-Tirmidhi 5/465, Ibn Majah 2/332, Ahmad. Ibn Majah's chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39. Hisnul Muslim 86

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #14
duas.ar_dua: رَضيـتُ بِاللهِ رَبَّـاً وَبِالإسْلامِ ديـناً وَبِمُحَـمَّدٍ نَبِيّـاً .
duas.transliteration: Raḍītu billāhi Rabba. wa bil-Islāmi dīna. wa bi-Muḥammadin (ṣallallāhu `alayhi wa sallama) nabiyya.
duas.en_translation: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as my Prophet.(Recite three times in Arabic.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Allah has promised that anyone who says this three times every morning or evening will be pleased on the Day of Resurrection. Ahmad 4/ 337, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 4, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 68), At-Tirmidhi 5/465. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39. Hisnul Muslim 87

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #15
duas.ar_dua: يا حَـيُّ يا قَيّـومُ بِـرَحْمَـتِكِ أَسْتَـغـيث  أَصْلِـحْ لي شَـأْنـي كُلَّـه  وَلا تَكِلـني إِلى نَفْـسي طَـرْفَةَ عَـين
duas.transliteration: Yā Ḥayyu yā Qayyūmu biraḥmatika astaghīthaṣlih lī sha'nī kullahwa lā takilnī ilā nafsī ṭarfata `ayn.
duas.en_translation: O Ever-Living One, O Eternal One, by Your mercy I call on You to set right all my affairs. Do not place me in charge of my soul even for the blinking of an eye (i. e. a moment).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), Al-Hakim 1/545, see Albani, Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib, 1/273. Hisnul Muslim 88

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #16
duas.ar_dua:
أَصْبَـحْـنا وَأَصْبَـحْ المُـلكُ للهِ رَبِّ العـالَمـين 

اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أسْـأَلُـكَ خَـيْرَ هـذا الـيَوْم فَـتْحَهُ وَنَصْـرَهُ وَنـورَهُ وَبَـرَكَتَـهُ وَهُـداهُ 

وَأَعـوذُ بِـكَ مِـنْ شَـرِّ ما فـيهِ وَشَـرِّ ما بَعْـدَه
duas.transliteration:
Aṣbaḥnā wa aṣbaḥal-mulku lillāhi Rabbi ‘l-a`lāmīn. 

Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayra hādha ‘l-yawm:Fat’ḥahu wa naṣrahu wa nūrahu. wa barakatahu, wa hudāh. 

wa a`ūdhu bika min sharri mā fīhiwa sharri mā ba`dah.
duas.en_translation:
We have entered a new day and with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists. 

O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of this day, ^2 its victory, its help, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. 

I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it, and from the evil that follows it.
duas.en_reference:
Reference: ^1 For evening recitation, say here: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayra hāthihil-laylah: "My Lord, I ask You for the good things of this night." 

^2 Abu Dawud 4/322. Its transmission chain is good (Hasan). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Zadul- Ma'ad 2/273. 

Hisnul Muslim 89

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #17
duas.ar_dua: أَصْـبَحْنا[أَمْسَـينا] علـى فِطْـرَةِ الإسْلام وَعَلـى كَلِـمَةِ الإخْـلاص وَعلـى دينِ نَبِـيِّنا مُحَـمَّدٍ وَعَلـى مِلَّـةِ أبينـا إِبْـراهيـمَ حَنيـفاً مُسْلِـماً وَمـا كـانَ مِنَ المُشـرِكيـن
duas.transliteration: Aṣbahnā `alā fiṭrati ‘l-Islām. wa `alā kalimati ‘l-ikhlās. wa `alā dīni nabiyyinā Muḥammadin (ṣallallāhu `alayhi wa sallam). wa `alā millati abīnā Ibrāhīm,ḥanīfan Muslimanwa mā kāna mina ‘l-mushrikīn.
duas.en_translation: We have entered a new day 1 upon the natural religion of Islam, the word of sincere devotion, the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the faith of our father Ibrahim. He was upright (in worshipping Allah), and a Muslim. He was not of those who worship others besides Allah. 2
duas.en_reference: Reference: 1 When you say this in the evening, you should say: 'Amsaynā `alā fiṭratil-Islām...: "We end this day..." 2 Ahmad 3/406-7, 5/123, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul- Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 34), At-Tirmidhi 4/209. Hisnul Muslim 90

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #18
duas.ar_dua: سُبْحـانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْـدِهِ . (مائة مرة)
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdih.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him.(Recite one hundred times in Arabic).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Whoever recites this one hundred times in the morning and in the evening will not be surpassed on the Day of Resurrection by anyone having done better than this except for someone who had recited it more. Al-Bukhari 4/2071. Hisnul Muslim 91

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #19
duas.ar_dua:
لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ لا شَـريكَ لهُ لهُ المُـلْكُ ولهُ الحَمْـد وهُوَ على كُلّ شَيءٍ قَدير .

 (عشر مرات أَوْ مرَّةً واحدةً عندَ الكَسَلِ)
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lah. lahu ‘l-mulku walahu ‘l-ḥamd. wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.en_translation:
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.

(Recite ten times ^1 in Arabic or one time to ward off laziness.) ^2
duas.en_reference:
Reference: ^1. Allah will write ten Hasanaat (rewards) for whoever recites this ten times in the morning, and forgive him ten misdeeds and give him the reward of freeing ten slaves and protect him from Satan. Whoever recites this ten times in the evening will get this same reward. An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 24). Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Albani 1/272. Abu Hurayrah «fe narrated that the Prophet j§ said: "Allah will write one hundred Hasanat for whoever says There is no God but Allah alone, He has no partner. To Allah is possession of everything, and to Him all praise is. He is Capable of all things' ten times in the morning, and forgive him one hundred misdeeds. He will have the reward of freeing a slave and will be protected from Satan throughout the day unto dusk. Whoever says it in the evening will have the same reward." Ahmad 8/704, 16/293. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 44. 

^2. Whoever recites this in the morning, will have the reward of freeing a slave from the Children of Isma'il. Ten Hasanaat (rewards) will be written for him, and he will be forgiven ten misdeeds, raised up ten degrees, and be protected from Satan until evening. Whoever says it in the evening will have the same reward until morning. Abu Dawud 4/319, 3/957, Ahmad 4/ 60, Ibn Majah 2/331, Ibn Al-Qayyim Zadul-Ma'ad 2/388. Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Al-Albani 1/270. 

Hisnul Muslim 92

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #20
duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ لا شَـريكَ لهُ لهُ المُـلْكُ ولهُ الحَمْـد وهُوَ على كُلّ شَيءٍ قَدير .
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lah. lahu ‘l-mulku walahu ‘l-ḥamd. wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.en_translation:
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.

(Recite 100 times in Arabic upon rising in the morning).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Whoever recites this one hundred times a day will have the reward of freeing ten slaves. One hundred Hasanaat (rewards) will be written for him and one hundred misdeeds will be washed away. He will be shielded from Satan until the evening. No one will be able to present anything better than this except for someone who has recited more than this. Al-Bukhari 4/95, Muslim 4/2071. Hisnul Muslim 93

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #21
duas.ar_dua: سُبْحـانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْـدِهِ عَدَدَ خَلْـقِه  وَرِضـا نَفْسِـه  وَزِنَـةَ عَـرْشِـه  وَمِـدادَ كَلِمـاتِـه
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdih:`adada khalqih. wa riḍā nafsih. wa zinata `arshih. wa midāda kalimātih.
duas.en_translation:
Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His Pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His Words.

(Recite three times in Arabic upon rising in the morning.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2090. Hisnul Muslim 94

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #22
duas.ar_dua:
اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْماً نَافِعاً وَرِزْقاً طَيِّباً وَعَمَلاً مُتَقَبَّلاً 

(إذا أصبحَ)
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka `ilman nāfi`a. wa rizqan ṭayyiba. wa `amalan mutaqabbala.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit, a good provision, and deeds that will be accepted.

(Recite in Arabic upon rising in the morning.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn As-Sunni, no. 54, Ibn Majah no. 925. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Al-Qayyim 2/375. Hisnul Muslim 95

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #23
duas.ar_dua:
أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ 

(مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ فِي الْيَوْمِ)
duas.transliteration: Astaghfirullāha wa atūbu ilayh.
duas.en_translation:
I seek the forgiveness of Allah and repent to Him. 

(Recite one hundred times in Arabic during the day.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101, Muslim 4/2075. Hisnul Muslim 96

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #24
duas.ar_dua:
أَعـوذُ بِكَلِمـاتِ اللّهِ التّـامّـاتِ مِنْ شَـرِّ ما خَلَـق 

(ثلاث مرات إِذا أمسى)
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti-llāhit-tāmmāti min sharri mā khalaq.
duas.en_translation:
I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.

(Recite three times in Arabic in the evening.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Whoever recites this three times in the evening will be protected from insect stings, Ahmad 2/ 290, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah no. 590, At-Tirmidhi 3/187, Ibn As-Sunni no. 68. According to Al-Albani, Ibn Majah's (2/266) chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), and following Ibn Baz 45, At-Tirmidhi's report is good (Hasan). Hisnul Muslim 97

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #1
duas.ar_dua:
اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَ سَلِّمْ عَلَى نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ 

(عشر مرات)
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ṣalli wa sallim `alā nabiyyinā Muḥammad.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, we ask for your peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad.

(Recite ten times in Arabic.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Who recites blessings upon me ten times in the morning and ten times in the evening will obtain my intercession on the Day of Resurrection." At-Tabarani reported this Hadith together with two chains of transmission. One of them is reliable (Jayyid). See Haythami's Majma'uz-Zawa'id 10/120, and Al-Albani's Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib 1/273. Hisnul Muslim 98

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #2
duas.ar_dua:
يَجْمَعُ كَفَّيْهِ ثُمَّ يَنْفُثُ فِيهِمَا فَيَقْرَأُ فِيهِمَا

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ 

قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ*
 اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ*
 لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ*
 وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُواً أَحَدٌ 

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ

 قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ*
 مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ*
 وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ*
 وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ*
 وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ

 بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ
 {قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ*
 مَلِكِ النَّاسِ*
 إِلَهِ النَّاسِ*
 مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ*
 الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ*
 مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ*  

أَقبَلَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ(يفعلُ ذلك ثلاثَ مرَّاتٍ))
duas.transliteration:
Bismillāhir-Raḥmānir-Raḥīm. 

Qul huwallāhu aḥad. 
Allāhuṣ-ṣamad. 
Lam yalid wa lam yūlad. 
Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aḥad. 

Bismillāhir-Raḥmānir-Raḥīm. 

Qul a`ūdhu birabbil-falaq. 
Min sharri mā khalaq. 
Wa min sharri ghāsiqin idhā waqab. 
Wa min sharrin-naffāthāti fil-`uqad. 
Wa min sharri ḥāsidin idhā ḥasad. 

Bismillāhir-Raḥmānir-Raḥīm. 

Qul a`ūdhu birabbin-nās. 
Malikin-nās. 
'Ilāhin-nās. 
Min sharri ‘l-waswāsil-khannās. 
Alladhī yuwaswisu fī ṣudūrin-nās. 
Minal-jinnati wannās.
duas.en_translation:
Hold the palms together, blow (with a little spittle) into them, and recite:

With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 

Say: He is Allah (the) One. 
The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, 
He begets not nor was He begotten, 
and there is none equal to Him. 

With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 

Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, 
from the evil of what He has created, 
and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, 
and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, 
and from the evil of the envier when he envies. 

With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 

Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, 
the King of mankind, 
the God of mankind, 
from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, 
who whispers in the breasts of mankind, 
of jinns and men.

(Then pass your hands over as much of your body as you can reach, beginning with the head and the face, then the entire front of your body. Do this three times.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 9/62, and Muslim 4/ 1723. Hisnul Muslim 99

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #3
duas.ar_dua:
اللّهُ لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ
 لاَ تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلاَ نَوْمٌ 
لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الأَرْضِ
 مَن ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِهِ
 يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ 
وَلاَ يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِ 
إِلاَّ بِمَا شَاء وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالأَرْضَ 
وَلاَ يَؤُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ
duas.transliteration:
Allāhu lā ilāha illā huwa ‘l-Ḥayyul-Qayyūm. 
lā ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa lā nawm. 
lahu mā fis-samāwāti wa mā fil-ardh. 
man dhal-ladhī yashfa`u `indahu illā bi'idhnih. 
ya`lamu mā bayna 'aydīhim wa mā khalfahum. 
wa lā yuḥītūna bishay'im-min `ilmihi illā bimā shā'a. 
wasi `a kursiyyuhus-samāwāti wal-ardh. 
wa lā ya'ūduhu hifẓuhumā. wa huwal-`Aliyyu ‘l-`Aẓīm.
duas.en_translation:
Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. 
Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. 
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. 
Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? 
He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. 
And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. 
His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. 
And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255. Whoever reads this when he lies down to sleep will have a guardian from Allah remain with him and Satan will not be able to come near him until he rises in the morning. See Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 4/487. Hisnul Muslim 100

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #4
duas.ar_dua:
((ءامَنَ الرَّسُولُ بِمَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مِن رَّبِّهِ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ كُلٌّ ءامَنَ بِاللهِ وَمَلآئِكَتِهِ وَكُتُبِهِ وَرُسُلِهِ لاَ نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّن رُّسُلِهِ وَقَالُواْ سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ {285}

 لاَ يُكَلِّفُ اللهُ نَفْسًا إِلاَّ وُسْعَهَا لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ رَبَّنَا لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنَا إِن نَّسِينَا أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا رَبَّنَا وَلاَ تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَا إِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُ عَلَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا رَبَّنَا وَلاَ تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لاَ طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِ وَاعْفُ عَنَّا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَآ أَنتَ مَوْلاَنَا فَانصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ {286}))
duas.transliteration:
[285] - Āmanar-Rasūlu bimā unzila ilaihi mir-Rabbihi wa ‘l-mu'minūn. kullun āmana billāhi wa malā'ikatihi wa kutubihi wa rusulih. lā nufarriqu bayna aḥadim-mir-rusulih. wa qālū sami`nā wa aṭa`nā. ghufrānaka Rabbanā wa ilayka ‘l-maṣīr. 

[286] - Lā yukallifu ‘llāhu nafsan illā wus`ahā. lahā mā kasabat wa `alayhā mak-tasabat. Rabbanā lā tu'ākhidhnā in nasīnā aw akhta'nā. Rabbanā wa lā taḥmil `alaynā iṣran kamā ḥamaltahu `alal-ladhīna min qablinā. Rabbanā wa lā tuḥammilnā mā lā ṭāqata lanā bih. wa`fu `annā, waghfir lanā, warḥamnā. Anta mawlānā fanṣurnā `ala ‘l-qawmi ‘l-kāfirīn.
duas.en_translation:
285. The Messenger believes in what has been sent down to him from his Lord, and so do the believers. Each one believes in Allah, His Angels, His Books, and His Messengers. They say: "We make no distinction between any of His Messengers, "and they say: "We hear, and we obey.(We seek) Your Forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the return. 

286. ”Allah burdens not a person beyond what he can bear. He gets rewarded for that (good) which he has earned, and he is punished for that (evil) which he has earned. Our Lord! Punish us not if we forget or fall into error. Our Lord! Lay not on us a burden like that which You did lay on those before us. Our Lord! Put not on us a burden greater than we have the strength to bear. Pardon us and grant us forgiveness. Have mercy on us. You are our Protector, and help us against the disbelieving people.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:285-6. These two Verses will be sufficient for anyone who recites them at night before sleeping. Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari.9/94, Muslim 1/554. Hisnul Muslim 101

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #5
duas.ar_dua: بِاسْمِكَ رَبِّي وَضَعْتُ جَنْبِي وَبِكَ أَرْفَعُهُ فَإِن أَمْسَكْتَ نَفْسِي فارْحَمْهَا وَإِنْ أَرْسَلْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا بِمَا تَحْفَظُ بِهِ عِبَادَكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Bismika Rabbī waḍa`tu janbī. wa bika arfa`uh. fa in amsakta nafsī farḥamhā. wa in arsaltahā faḥfaẓhābimā taḥfaẓu bihi `ibādakaṣ-ṣāliḥīn.
duas.en_translation: With Your Name ^1 my Lord, I lay myself down; and with Your Name I rise. And if You take my soul, have mercy on it, and if You send it back then protect it as You protect Your righteous slaves. ^2
duas.en_reference:
Reference: ^1 "If any of you rises from his bed and later returns to it, let him dust off his bed with his waist garment three times and mention the Name of Allah, for he does not know what may have entered the bed after him, and when he lies down he should say. . . ". 

^2 Al-Bukhari 1 1/ 126 and Muslim 4/2084. 

Hisnul Muslim 102

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #6
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِي وَأَنْتَ تَوَفَّاهَا لَكَ مَمَاتُهَا وَمَحْياهَا إِنْ أَحْيَيْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا وَإِنْ أَمَتَّهَا فَاغْفِرْ لَهَا. اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ العَافِيَةَ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innaka khalaqta nafsīwa anta tawaffāhā. laka mamātuhā wa maḥyāhā. in aḥyaytahā faḥfaẓhā. wa in amattahā faghfir lahā. Allāhumma innī as'aluka ‘l-`āfiyah.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, You have created my soul and You take it back. Unto You is its death and its life. If You give it life then protect it, and if You cause it to die then forgive it. O Allah, I ask You for strength.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2083 and Ahmad 2/79. Hisnul Muslim 103

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #7
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ قِنـي عَذابَـكَ يَـوْمَ تَبْـعَثُ عِبـادَك
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma qinī `adhābaka yawma tab`athu `ibādak.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, ^1 save me from Your punishment on the Day that You resurrect Your slaves. ^2
duas.en_reference: Reference: ^1 "When the Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to lie down to sleep, he used to place his right hand under his cheek and say..." \n^2 Abu Dawud 4/311. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/143. Hisnul Muslim 104

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #8
duas.ar_dua: بِاسْـمِكَ اللّهُـمَّ أَمـوتُ وَأَحْـيا
duas.transliteration: Bismika Allāhumma amūtu wa aḥyā.
duas.en_translation: In Your Name, O Allah, I die and I live.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Here, dying and living are metaphors for sleep and wakefulness. This explains why the normal order of these words has been reversed in this Hadith. In other contexts the living is mentioned before dying. See Qur'an Al-Baqarah 2:258, Aal-'Imrdn 3:156, Al-A'raf 7:158 among many other examples, (trans.). See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/ 2083. Hisnul Muslim 105

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #9
duas.ar_dua:
سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ (ثلاثاً وثلاثين)
 وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ (ثلاثاً وثلاثين)
 وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ (أربعاً وثلاثينَ)
duas.transliteration:
Subḥānallāh. 
Wa ‘l-ḥamdu lillāh. 
Wallāhu Akbar.
duas.en_translation:
Glory is to Allah (thirty-three times in Arabic), 
Praise is to Allah (thirty-three times), 
Allah is the Most Great (thirty-four times)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 7/71, Muslim 4/2091. Hisnul Muslim 106

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #10
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ رَبَّ السّمـواتِ السَّبْـعِ وَرَبَّ العَـرْشِ العَظـيم رَبَّنـا وَرَبَّ كُـلِّ شَـيء فالِـقَ الحَـبِّ وَالنَّـوى وَمُـنَزِّلَ التَّـوْراةِ وَالإنْجـيل والفُـرْقان أَعـوذُ بِـكَ مِن شَـرِّ كُـلِّ شَـيءٍ أَنْـتَ آخِـذٌ بِنـاصِـيَتِه اللّهُـمَّ أَنْـتَ الأوَّلُ فَلَـيسَ قَبْـلَكَ شَيء وَأَنْـتَ الآخِـرُ فَلَـيسَ بَعْـدَكَ شَيء وَأَنْـتَ الظّـاهِـرُ فَلَـيْسَ فَـوْقَـكَ شَيء وَأَنْـتَ الْبـاطِـنُ فَلَـيْسَ دونَـكَ شَيء اقـْضِ عَنّـا الـدَّيْـنَ وَأَغْـنِنـا مِنَ الفَـقْر
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma Rabbas-samāwātis-sab`iwa Rabba ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-`Aẓīm. Rabbanā wa Rabba kulli shay'. fāliqa ‘l-ḥabbi wan-nawā. wa munzilat-Tawrāti wal-'Injīli, wal-Furqān. a`ūdhu bika min sharri kulli shay'inanta ākhidhun bināṣiyatih. Allāhumma anta ‘l-awwalu falaysa qablaka shay'. wa antal-ākhiru falaysa ba`daka shay'. wa antaẓ-ẓāhiru falaysa fawqaka shay'. wa antal-bāṭinu falaysa dūnaka shay'. iqḍi `annad-dayn. wa aghninā mina ‘l-faqr.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Magnificent Throne. Our Lord and the Lord of everything. Splitter of the grain and the date-stone, Revealer of the Torah and the Injeel ^1 

and the Furqan (the Qur'an), I seek refuge in You from the evil of everything that You shall seize by the forelock.^2

O Allah You are the First and nothing has come before you, and You are the Last, and nothing may come after You. You are the Most High, nothing is above You and You are the Most Near, and nothing is nearer than You. Remove our debts from usand enrich us against poverty. ^3
duas.en_reference:
Reference: 
^1 The Scripture that was revealed to 'Isa (Jesus). 
^2 See Qur'an Al-'Alaq 96:15, where seizure by the forelock preceeds being cast into Hell. (Translator) 
^3 Muslim 4/2084. 

Hisnul Muslim 107

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #11
duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا وَكَفَانَا وَآوَانَا فَكَمْ مِمَّنْ لاَ كَافِيَ لَهُ وَلاَ مُؤْوِيَ
duas.transliteration: Alḥamdu lillāhil-lathī 'aṭ`amanā wa saqānā. wa kafānā, wa 'āwānā. fakam mimman lā kāfiya lahu wa lā mu'wī.
duas.en_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has provided us with food and with drink, sufficed us and gave us an abode, for how many are there with no provision and no home.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2085. Hisnul Muslim 108

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #12
duas.ar_dua:
اللّهُـمَّ عالِـمَ الغَـيْبِ وَالشّـهادَةِ فاطِـرَ السّماواتِ وَالأرْضِ رَبَّ كـلِّ شَـيءٍ وَمَليـكَه أَشْهَـدُ أَنْ لا إِلـهَ إِلاّ أَنْت

 أَعـوذُ بِكَ مِن شَـرِّ نَفْسـي وَمِن شَـرِّ الشَّيْـطانِ وَشِـرْكِه وَأَنْ أَقْتَـرِفَ عَلـى نَفْسـي سوءاً أَوْ أَجُـرَّهُ إِلـى مُسْـلِم
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma `ālima ‘l-ghaybi wash-shahādah. fātiras-samāwāti wa ‘l-ardh. Rabba kulli shay'in wa malīkah. ash-hadu an lā ilāha illā ant. 

a`ūdhu bika min sharri nafsī. wa min sharrish-shayṭāni wa shirkih. wa an aqtarifa `alā nafsī sū'an. aw ajurrahu ilā Muslim.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the evident, Maker of the heavens and the earth, Lord of everything and its Master, I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. 

I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul, and from the evil of Satan and his helpers. (I seek refuge in You) from bringing evil upon my soul and from harming any Muslim.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/317. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/142. Hisnul Muslim 109

duas.subtitle: Before sleeping #13
duas.ar_dua: يقرأ ((ألم * تنزيل)) السجدة و((تبارك الذي بيده الملك))
duas.en_translation: Recite Surah 32 (As-Sajdah) and Surah 67 (Al-Mulk) in Arabic.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami ' As-Saghir 4/255 Hisnul Muslim 110

duas.subtitle: When tossing and turning during the night
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ أَسْـلَمْتُ نَفْـسي إِلَـيْكَ وَفَوَّضْـتُ أَمْـري إِلَـيْكَ وَوَجَّـهْتُ وَجْـهي إِلَـيْكَ وَأَلْـجَـاْتُ ظَهـري إِلَـيْكَ رَغْبَـةً وَرَهْـبَةً إِلَـيْكَ لا مَلْجَـأَ وَلا مَنْـجـا مِنْـكَ إِلاّ إِلَـيْكَ آمَنْـتُ بِكِتـابِكَ الّـذي أَنْزَلْـتَ وَبِنَبِـيِّـكَ الّـذي أَرْسَلْـت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma aslamtu nafsī ilayk. wa fawwaḍtu amrī ilayk. wa wajjahtu wajhī ilayk. wa alja'tu ẓahrī ilayk. raghbatan wa rahbatan ilayk. lā malja'a wa la manjā minka illā ilayk,āmantu bikitābika ‘l-ladhī anzalt. wa bi-nabiyyika ‘l-ladhī arsalt.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I submit myself to You, entrust my affairs to You, turn my face to You, and lay myself down depending upon You, hoping in You and fearing You. There is no refuge, and no escape, except to You. I believe in Your Book (the Qur'an) that You revealed, and the Prophet whom You sent.
duas.en_reference: Reference: "Before you go to bed perform ablutions as you would for prayer, then lie down on your right side and say. . . " The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever says this and dies in his sleep, has died in a state of the natural monotheism (Fitrah)." Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/2081. Hisnul Muslim 111

duas.subtitle: Upon experiencing unrest, fear, apprehensiveness during sleep
duas.ar_dua: لا إِلـهَ إِلاّ اللهُ الـواحِدُ القَهّـار رَبُّ السَّـمواتِ وَالأرْضِ وَما بَيْـنَهـما العَزيـزُ الغَـفّار
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhal-Wāḥidul-Qahhār. Rabbus-samāwāti wa ‘l-arḍi wa mā baynahumaal-`Azīzul-Ghaffār.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the One, the Victorious, Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the All-Forgiving.
duas.en_reference: Reference: This is to be said if you turn over in bed during the night. Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/540. Also see An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Ibn As-Sunni. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/ 213. Hisnul Muslim 112

duas.subtitle: Upon seeing a good dream or a bad dream #1
duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِكَلِمـاتِ اللّهِ التّـامّـاتِ مِن غَضَـبِهِ وَعِـقابِهِ وَشَـرِّ عِبـادِهِ وَمِنْ هَمَـزاتِ الشَّـياطينِ وَأَنْ يَحْضـرون
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmātimin ghaḍabihi wa `iqābihi wa sharri `ibādih. wa min hamazātish-shayāṭīni wa an yaḥḍurūn.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from His anger and His punishment, from the evil of His slaves, and from the taunts of devils and from their presence.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/12. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmidhi 3/171 Hisnul Muslim 113

duas.subtitle: Upon seeing a good dream or a bad dream #2
duas.ar_dua:
يَنْفُثُ عَنْ يَسَارِهِ (ثلاثاً).
 
يَسْتَعِيذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا رَأَى (ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ)

 لاَ يُحَدِّثْ بِهَا أَحَداً
 يَــتَحَوَّلُ عَنْ جَنْبِهِ الَّذِي كَانَ عَلَيْهِ
duas.en_translation:
Spit to your left (three times). ^1
Seek refuge in Allah from the Devil and from the evil of what you have seen (three times). ^2
Do not speak about it to anyone. ^3
Turn over on your other side. ^4
duas.en_reference:
Reference: 
^1. Muslim 4/1 772. 
^2. Muslim 4/1 772. 
^3. Muslim 4/1772. 
^4. Muslim 4/1773. 

Hisnul Muslim 114

duas.subtitle: Qunoot Al-Witr #1
duas.ar_dua: يقوم يصلي إن أراد ذلك.ويَقُومُ يُصَلِّي إِنْ أَرَادَ ذَلِكَ.
duas.en_translation: Get up and pray if you desire to do so.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/1773. Hisnul Muslim 115

duas.subtitle: Qunoot Al-Witr #2
duas.ar_dua:
اللّهُـمَّ اهْـدِنـي فـيمَنْ هَـدَيْـت وَعـافِنـي فـيمَنْ عافَـيْت وَتَوَلَّـني فـيمَنْ تَوَلَّـيْت وَبارِكْ لـي فـيما أَعْطَـيْت وَقِـني شَرَّ ما قَضَـيْت فَإِنَّـكَ تَقْـضي وَلا يُقْـضى عَلَـيْك  

إِنَّـهُ لا يَـذِلُّ مَنْ والَـيْت [ وَلا يَعِـزُّ مَن عـادَيْت ] تَبـارَكْـتَ رَبَّـنا وَتَعـالَـيْت
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma’hdinī fī man hadayt. wa `āfinī fī man `āfayt. wa tawallanī fī man tawallayt. wa bārik lī fī mā a`atayt. wa qinī sharra mā qaḍayt. fa innaka taqḍī wa lā yuqḍā `alayk. 

innahu lā yadhillu man wālayt,[wa lā ya`izzu man `ādayt] . tabārakta Rabbanā wa ta`ālayt.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, guide me with those whom You have guided, and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength. Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care. Bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil You have ordained. 

Surely, You command and are not commanded, and none whom You have committed to Your care shall be humiliated[and none whom You have taken as an enemy shall taste glory]. You are Blessed, Our Lord, and Exalted.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ahmad, Ad-Darimi, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/144, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW. 2/ 172. Hisnul Muslim 116

duas.subtitle: Qunoot Al-Witr #3
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أَعـوذُ بِرِضـاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِـك وَبِمُعـافاتِـكَ مِنْ عُقوبَـتِك وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْـك لا أُحْصـي ثَنـاءً عَلَـيْك أَنْـتَ كَمـا أَثْنَـيْتَ عَلـى نَفْسـِك
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu biriḍāka min sakhaṭik. wa bimu`āfātika min `uqūbatik. wa a`ūdhu bika mink. lā uḥṣī thanā'an `alayk. Anta kamā athnayta `alā nafsik.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with Your Pleasure from Your anger. I seek refuge in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek refuge in You from You. I cannot count Your praises, You are as You have praised Yourself.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ahmad. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/180, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil. 2/ 175. Hisnul Muslim 117

duas.subtitle: Immediately after salam of the witr prayer
duas.ar_dua:
اللّهُـمَّ إِيّـاكَ نعْـبُدْ وَلَـكَ نُصَلّـي وَنَسْـجُد وَإِلَـيْكَ نَسْـعى وَنَحْـفِد نَـرْجو رَحْمَـتَك وَنَخْشـى عَـذابَك إِنَّ عَـذابَكَ بالكـافرين ملْحَـق. 

اللّهُـمَّ إِنّا نَسْتَعـينُكَ وَنَسْتَـغْفِرُك وَنُثْـنـي عَلَـيْك الخَـيْرَ وَلا نَكْـفُرُك وَنُـؤْمِنُ بِك وَنَخْـضَعُ لَكَ وَنَخْـلَعُ مَنْ يَكْـفرُك
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma iyyāka na`bud. wa laka nuṣallī wa nasjud. wa ilayka nas`ā wa naḥfid. narjū raḥmatak. wa nakhshā `adhābak. inna `adhābaka bilkāfirīna mulḥaq. 

Allāhumma innā nasta`īnuk. wa nastaghfiruk. wa nuthnī `alaykal-khayr. wa lā nakfuruk. wa nu'minu bik. wa nakhḍa`u lak. wa nakhla`u man yakfuruk.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, You alone do we worship, and to You we pray and bow down prostrate. To You we hasten to worship and to serve. Our hope is for Your mercy, and we fear Your punishment. Surely, Your punishment of the disbelievers is at hand. 

O Allah, we seek Your help and Your forgiveness, and we praise You beneficently. We do not deny You and we believe in You. We surrender to You and renounce whoever disbelieves in You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bayhaqi graded its chain authentic in As-Sunan Al-Kubra. Al-Albani said in 'Irwa'ul-GhaliL 2/170 that its chain is authentic as a statement of 'Umar. Hisnul Muslim 118

duas.subtitle: For anxiety and sorrow #1
duas.ar_dua: سبحان الملك القدوس' [ثلاث مرات والثالثة يجهر بها ويمد بها صوته] 'ربِّ الملائكةِ والرّوح'
duas.transliteration: Subḥāna ‘l-Maliki ‘l-Quddūs. [Recite three times, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say...] Rabbi ‘l-Malā'ikati war-rūh.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to the King, the Holy.[Recite three times in Arabic, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say...] Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
duas.en_reference: Reference: An-Nasa'i 3/244, Ad-Daraqutni and others. The final addition is from Ad-Daraqutni's version 2/ 31 and its chain of narration is authentic. See the checking of Zadul-Ma'ad by Shu'aib Al-Arna'ut and 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut 1/337. Hisnul Muslim 119

duas.subtitle: For anxiety and sorrow #2
duas.ar_dua:
اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّي عَبْـدُكَ ابْنُ عَبْـدِكَ ابْنُ أَمَتِـكَ نَاصِيَتِي بِيَـدِكَ مَاضٍ فِيَّ حُكْمُكَ عَدْلٌ فِيَّ قَضَاؤكَ

 أَسْأَلُـكَ بِكُلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ سَمَّـيْتَ بِهِ نَفْسَكَ أِوْ أَنْزَلْتَـهُ فِي كِتَابِكَ أَوْ عَلَّمْـتَهُ أَحَداً مِنْ خَلْقِـكَ أَوِ اسْتَـأْثَرْتَ بِهِ فِي عِلْمِ الغَيْـبِ عِنْـدَكَ أَنْ تَجْـعَلَ القُرْآنَ رَبِيـعَ قَلْبِـي وَنورَ صَـدْرِي وجَلَاءَ حُـزْنِي وذَهَابَ هَمِّـي
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma innī `abduk. ibnu `abdik. ibnu amatik. nāsiyatī biyadik. māḍin fiyya ḥukmuk,`adlun fiyya qaḍā'uk. 

as'aluka bikullis’min huwa lak. sammayta bihi nafsak. aw anzaltahu fī kitābik. aw `allamtahu aḥadan min khalqik. aw‘ista'tharta bihi fī `ilmil-ghaybi `indak. an taj`ala ‘l-Qur'āna rabī`a qalbī. wa nūra ṣadrī. wa jalā'a ḥuznī. wa dhahāba hammī.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, I am Your slave, and the son of Your male slave, and the son of your female slave. My forehead is in Your Hand (i. e. you have control over me). Your Judgment upon me is assured, and Your Decree concerning me is just. 

I ask You by every Name that You have named Yourself with, revealed in Your Book, taught any one of Your creation, or kept unto Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen that is with You, to make the Qur'an the spring of my heart, and the light of my chest, the banisher of my sadness, and the reliever of my distress.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 1/391, and Al-Albani graded it authentic. Hisnul Muslim 120

duas.subtitle: For one in distress #1
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَعْوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الهَـمِّ وَ الْحُـزْنِ والعًجْـزِ والكَسَلِ والبُخْـلِ والجُـبْنِ وضَلْـعِ الـدَّيْنِ وغَلَبَـةِ الرِّجال
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma 'innī 'a`ūdhu bikamina ‘l-ḥammi wa ‘l-ḥuzn. wa ‘l-`ajzi wa ‘l-kasal. wa ‘l-bukhli wa ‘l-jubn. wa ḍala`id-dayn. wa ghalabatir-rijāl.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i. e. others).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/158. See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/173. Hisnul Muslim 121

duas.subtitle: For one in distress #2
duas.ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْعَظـيمُ الْحَلِـيمْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ رَبُّ العَـرْشِ العَظِيـمِ لَا إِلَـهَ إِلَّا اللَّهْ رَبُّ السَّمَـوّاتِ ورّبُّ الأَرْضِ ورَبُّ العَرْشِ الكَـريم
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhal-`Aẓīmul-Ḥalīm. lā ilāha illallāh Rabbu ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-'Aẓīm. lā ilāha illallāh Rabbus-samāwāti wa Rabbu ‘l-arḍwa Rabbu ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-Karīm.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the Mighty, the Forbearing. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, and Lord of the Noble Throne.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 8/154, Muslim 4/2092 Hisnul Muslim 122

duas.subtitle: For one in distress #3
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ رَحْمَتَـكَ أَرْجـو فَلا تَكِلـني إِلى نَفْـسي طَـرْفَةَ عَـيْن وَأَصْلِـحْ لي شَأْنـي كُلَّـه لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أنْـت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma raḥmataka arjūfalā takilnī ilā nafsī ṭarfata `ayn. wa aṣliḥ lī sha'nī kullah. lā ilāha illā ant.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I hope for Your mercy. Do not leave me to myself even for the blinking of an eye (i. e. a moment). Correct all of my affairs for me. There is none worthy of worship but You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42. Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/959. Hisnul Muslim 123

duas.subtitle: For one in distress #4
duas.ar_dua: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أنْـت سُـبْحانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْـتُ مِنَ الظّـالِميـن
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illā anta subḥānakainnī kuntu minaẓ-ẓālimīn.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but You, glory is to You. Surely, I was among the wrongdoers.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/529. Al-Hakim declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/ 505. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/168. Hisnul Muslim 124

duas.subtitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #1
duas.ar_dua: اللهُ اللهُ رَبِّي لا أُشْـرِكُ بِهِ شَيْـئاً
duas.transliteration: Allāh, Allāhu Rabbī lā ushriku bihi shay'a.
duas.en_translation: Allah, Allah is my Lord. I do not associate anything with Him.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/87. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mdjah 2/335. Hisnul Muslim 125

duas.subtitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #2
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنا نَجْـعَلُكَ في نُحـورِهِـم وَنَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرورِهـمْ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innā naj`aluka fī nuḥūrihimwa na`ūdhu bika min shurūrihim.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, we ask You to restrain them by their necks, and we seek refuge in You from their evil.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/89, and Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 2/142. Hisnul Muslim 126

duas.subtitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #3
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ أَنْتَ عَضُـدي وَأَنْتَ نَصـيري بِكَ أَجـولُ وَبِكَ أَصـولُ وَبِكَ أُقـاتِل
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta `aḍudī, wa anta naṣīrī. bika ajūlu, wa bika aṣūlu, wa bika uqātil.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, You are my strength and You are my support. For Your sake, I go forth and for Your sake, I advance and for Your sake, I fight.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 3/42, At-Tirmidhi 5/572. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/183. Hisnul Muslim 127

duas.subtitle: For one afraid of the ruler's injustice #1
duas.ar_dua: حَسْبُـنا اللهُ وَنِعْـمَ الوَكـيل
duas.transliteration: Ḥasbunallāhu wa ni`mal-wakīl.
duas.en_translation: Allah is sufficient for us and the best of those on whom to depend.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, 5/172. Hisnul Muslim 128

duas.subtitle: For one afraid of the ruler's injustice #2
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ ربَّ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ كُنْ لِي جَاراً مِنْ فُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنٍ وَأَحْزَابِهِ مِنْ خَلاَئِقِكَ أَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيَّ أَحَدٌ مِنْهُمْ أَوْ يَطْغَى عَزَّ جَارُكَ وَجَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma Rabbas-samāwātis-sab`. wa Rabba ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-`Aẓīm. kun lī jāran min [here you mention the person's name]. wa aḥzābihi min khalā'iqik. an yafruṭa `alayya aḥadun minhum aw yaṭghā,`azza jāruk. wa jalla thanā'uk. wa lā ilāha illā ant.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, be for me a support against [such and such a person] and his helpers from among your creatures, lest any of them abuse me or do me wrong. Mighty is Your patronage, and glorious are Your praises. There is none worthy of worship but You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 707). Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 545). Hisnul Muslim 129

duas.subtitle: Against enemies
duas.ar_dua:
الله أكبر الله أعز من خلقه جميعاً  الله أعز مما أخاف وأحذر  أعوذ بالله الذي لا إله إلا هو  الممسك السموات السبع أن يقعن على الأرض إلا بإذنه  من شر عبدك فلان  وجنوده وأتباعه وأشياعه  من الجن والأنس 

 اللهم كن لي جاراً من شرهم  جل ثناؤك وعز جارك  وتبارك اسمك  ولا إله غيرك 

(ثلاث مرات)
duas.transliteration:
Allāhu Akbar. Allāhu a`azzu min khalqihi jamī`a. Allāhu a`azzu mimmā akhāfu wa aḥdhar. a`ūdhu billāhi ‘l-ladhī lā ilāha illā hū. almumsikis-samāwātis-sab`ian yaqa`na `ala ‘l-arḍi illā bi idhnih. min sharri `abdika [name of the person]. wa junūdihi wa atbā`ihi wa ashyā`ih. mina ‘l-jinni wa ‘l-ins. 

Allāhumma kun lī jāran min sharrihim. jalla thanā'uk. wa `azza jāruk. wa tabāraka-smuk. wa lā ilāha ghayruk.
duas.en_translation:
Allah is the Most Great, Mightier than all His creation. He is Mightier than what I fear and dread. I seek refuge in Allah, Who there is none worthy of worship but Him. He is the One Who holds the seven heavens from falling upon the earth except by His command.[I seek refuge in You Allah] from the evil of Your slave [name of the person], and his helpers, his followers, and his supporters from among the jinn and mankind. 

O Allah, be my support against their evil. Glorious are Your praises and mighty is Your patronage. Blessed is Your Name, there is no true God but You. 

(Recite three times in Arabic.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, 5/172. Hisnul Muslim 130

duas.subtitle: When being afraid of a group of people
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ مُنْزِلَ الْكِتَاب سَرِيعَ الْحِسَاب اهْزِم الأَحْزَاب اللَّهُمَّ اهْزِمْهُمْ وَ زَلْزِلْهُم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma munzila ‘l-kitāb. sarī`a ‘l-ḥisāb. ihzimi ‘l-aḥzāb. Allāhumma-hzimhum wa zalzilhum.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Revealer of the Book, Swift to account, defeat the groups (of disbelievers). O Allah, defeat them and shake them.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 3/1362. Hisnul Muslim 131

duas.subtitle: For one afflicted with doubt in his faith #1
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِيهِم بمَا شِئْت
duas.transliteration: Allāhummak-finīhim bimā shi't.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, suffice (i. e. protect) me against them however You wish.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2300. Hisnul Muslim 132

duas.subtitle: For one afflicted with doubt in his faith #2
duas.ar_dua: (أَعـوذُ بِاللهِ  (يَسْتَعِيذُ بِاللَّهِ  يَنْتَهِي عَمَّا شك فِيهِ
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāh
duas.en_translation: (Say:) I seek refuge in Allah. (Then you should desist from doing what you are in doubt about.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/336, Muslim 1/120. Hisnul Muslim 133

duas.subtitle: For one afflicted with doubt in his faith #3
duas.ar_dua: يقول' آمنت بالله ورسله'
duas.transliteration: Āmantu billāhi wa Rusulih.
duas.en_translation: (Say:) I believe in Allah and His Messengers.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim, 1/119-20. Hisnul Muslim 134

duas.subtitle: Settling a debt #1
duas.ar_dua: ((هُوَ الأوَّلُ وَالآخِـرُ وَالظّـاهِـرُ وَالْبـاطِـنُ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَلـيم))
duas.transliteration: Huwa ‘l-Awwalu wa ‘l-Ākhir. waẓ-Ẓāhiru wal-Bāṭin. wa huwa bikulli shay'in `Alīm.
duas.en_translation: (Recite the Ayat) He is the First and the Last, the Most High and the Most Near. And He is the Knower of all things (in Arabic).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Hadid 57:3, Abu Dawud 4/329. Al-Albani graded it good in SahihAbu Dawud, 3/962. Hisnul Muslim 135

duas.subtitle: Settling a debt #2
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ اكْفِـني بِحَلالِـكَ عَنْ حَـرامِـك وَأَغْنِـني بِفَضْـلِكَ عَمَّـنْ سِـواك
duas.transliteration: Allāhummak-finī biḥalālika `an ḥarāmik. wa 'aghninī bi faḍlika `amman siwāk.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and make me independent of all others besides You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/560. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/180. Hisnul Muslim 136

duas.subtitle: For one afflicted by whisperings in prayer or recitation
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika mina ‘l-ḥammi wa ‘l-ḥazan. wa ‘l-`ajzi wa ‘l-kasal. wa ‘l-bukhli wa ‘l-jubn. wa ḍala`id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijāl.
duas.en_translation: O Allah! I seek refuge with You from worry and grief, from incapacity and laziness, from cowardice and miserliness, from being heavily in debt and from being overpowered by (other) men.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/158. Hisnul Muslim 137

duas.subtitle: For one whose affairs have become difficult
duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ وَاتْفُلْ عَلَى يَسَارِكَ (ثلاثاً)
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāhi minash-shayṭānir-rajīm.
duas.en_translation: (Say:) I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast(then blow with a little spittle to your left). (Do this three times reciting in Arabic.)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/1729. Hisnul Muslim 138

duas.subtitle: Upon committing a sin
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ سَهْلَ إِلاَّ مَا جَعَلْتَهُ سَهْلاً وَأَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزْنَ إِذَا شِئْتَ سَهْلاً
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma lā saḥla illā ma ja`altahu saḥlawa anta taj`alu ‘l-ḥazna idhā shi'ta saḥla.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, there is no ease other than what You make easy. If You please You ease sorrow.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn Hibban in his Sahih (no. 2427), and Ibn As- Sunni (no. 351). Al-Hafidh (Ibn Hajar) said that this Hadith is authentic. It was also declared authentic by 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-Athkarp. 106. Hisnul Muslim 139

duas.subtitle: For expelling the devil and his whisperings #1
duas.ar_dua: مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ يُذنِبُ ذَنْباً فَيُحْسِنُ الطُّهُورَ ثُمَّ يَقُومُ فَيُصَلِّي رَكْعَتَيْنِ ثُمَّ يَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ إِلاَّ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ
duas.en_translation: There is not any slave of Allah who commits a sin, then he perfects his purification and stands to pray two Rak'ahs of prayer, then seeks Allah's forgiveness, except that Allah will forgive him.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/86, At-Tirmidhi 2/257. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/283. Hisnul Muslim 140

duas.subtitle: For expelling the devil and his whisperings #2
duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāhi minash-shayṭānir-rajīm.
duas.en_translation: Seeking refuge with Allah against him (i. e. by saying I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 1/206, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/77, and Surat Al-Mu'minun, 23:98-9. Hisnul Muslim 141

duas.subtitle: For expelling the devil and his whisperings #3
duas.ar_dua: الْأَذَانُ
duas.en_translation: The call to prayer - 'Athan.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 1/291, Al-Bukhari 1/151. Hisnul Muslim 142

duas.subtitle: When stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair
duas.ar_dua: الْأَذْكَارُ وَقِرَاءَةُ الْقُرْآنِ
duas.en_translation: Saying words of Allah's remembrance (Thikr) and recitation of the Qur'an.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Do not turn your homes into graveyards, surely the Devil flees from the house in which Surat Al-Baqarah is read, Muslim 1/539. The Devil is also driven out by the invocations for morning and evening, those that are said before sleeping and upon waking up, those for entering and leaving the house, including those for entering and leaving the mosque, and by many other authentic invocations taught to us by the Prophet (ﷺ) such as the reading of 'Ayatul-Kursi, (Al-Baqarah 2:255), and the last two 'Ayat of Surat Al-Baqarah before going to sleep. Whoever says: "There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and he is Able to do all things," one hundred times, it will be a protection for him from the Devil throughout the day.' Hisnul Muslim 143

duas.subtitle: Congratulation on the occasion of a birth and its reply
duas.ar_dua: قَدَّرَ اللهُ وَما شـاءَ فَعَـل
duas.transliteration: Qaddarallāhu wa mā shā'a fa`al.
duas.en_translation: It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.
duas.en_reference: Reference: The strong believer is better and more dear to Allah than the weak believer, and in each of them there is good. Be vigilant for what is to your benefit and seek the help of Allah and do not falter. But when you are striken by some setback, do not say: 'If only I had done such and such,' rather say: 'It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.' For verily the saying 'if (i.e. if only I had) begins the work of the Devil. Muslim 4/2052. Hisnul Muslim 144

duas.subtitle: Placing childen under Allah’s protection
duas.ar_dua:
(بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ لَكَ وَشَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ وَبَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَرُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ). وَيَرُدُّ عَلَيْهِ الْمُهَــــــنَّأُ فَيَقُولُ: (بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ 

(عَلَيْكَ وَجَزَاكَ اللَّهُ خَيْراً وَرَزَقَكَ اللَّهُ مِثْلَهُ وَأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ).
duas.transliteration:
Bārakallāhu laka fi ‘l-mawhūbi lak. wa shakarta ‘l-wāhib. wa balagha ashuddah. wa ruziqta birrah.

(The reply of the person being congratulated is to say): 
Bārakallahu laka wa bāraka `alayk. wa jazākallāhu khayra. wa razaqakallāhu mithlah. wa ajzala thawābak.
duas.en_translation:
May Allah bless you with His gift to you, and may you (the new parent) give thanks, may the child reach the maturity of years, and may you be granted its righteousness. 

The reply of the person being congratulated is to say: 
May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and may Allah reward you well and bestow upon you its like and reward you abundantly
duas.en_reference: Reference: An-Nawawi, Kitdbul-'Athkarp. 349, and Sahihul-'Athkar2/7l3 by Saleem Al-Hilali. Hisnul Muslim 145

duas.subtitle: When visiting the sick #1
duas.ar_dua: ' أعيذكما بكلمات الله التامة  من كل شيطان وهامة  ومن كل عينِ لامة '
duas.transliteration: U`īthukumā bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmatimin kulli shayṭānin wa hāmmah. wa min kulli `aynin lāmmah
duas.en_translation: I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allah from every devil and every beast, and from every envious blameworthy eye.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari4/119. Hisnul Muslim 146

duas.subtitle: When visiting the sick #2
duas.ar_dua: لا بأْسَ طَهـورٌ إِنْ شـاءَ الله
duas.transliteration: Lā ba'sa ṭahūrun in shā Allāh.
duas.en_translation: Do not worry, it will be a purification (for you), Allah willing.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani Fathul-Bari 10/118. Hisnul Muslim 147

duas.subtitle: Excellence of visiting the sick
duas.ar_dua: أَسْـأَلُ اللهَ العَـظيـم رَبَّ العَـرْشِ العَـظيـم أَنْ يَشْفـيك (سبع مرات)
duas.transliteration: As'alullāha ‘l-`Aẓīma Rabba ‘l-`Arshil-`Aẓīmi an yashfiyak.
duas.en_translation: I ask Almighty Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, to make you well. (Recite seven times in Arabic .)
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/210 and Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/180. Hisnul Muslim 148

duas.subtitle: When the sick have renounced all hope of life #1
duas.ar_dua:
قَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (إِذَا عَادَ الرَّجُلُ أَخَاهُ الْمُسْلِمَ مَشَى فِي خِرَافَةِ الْجَنَّةِ حَتَّى يَجْلِسَ فَإِذَا جَلَسَ غَمَرَتْهُ الرَّحْمَةُ

(فَإِنْ كَانَ غُدْوَةً صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ وَإِنْ كَانَ مَسَاءً صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ)
duas.en_translation:
When a man goes to visit his sick Muslim brother, he walks along a path of Paradise until he sits, and when he sits he is cloaked in mercy. 

If he comes in the morning, seventy thousand angels pray for him until evening, and if he comes in the evening, seventy thousand angels pray for him until morning.
duas.en_reference: Reference:  Hisnul Muslim 149

duas.subtitle: When the sick have renounced all hope of life #2
duas.ar_dua: أللّهُـمَّ اغْفِـرْ لي وَارْحَمْـني وَأَلْحِقْـني بِالرَّفـيقِ الأّعْلـى
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir lī warḥamnīwa alḥiqnī bir-rafīqi ‘l-'A`alā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive me and have mercy upon me, and join me with the highest companions (in Paradise).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari7/10, Muslim 4/1893. Hisnul Muslim 150

duas.subtitle: When the sick have renounced all hope of life #3
duas.ar_dua: لا إله إلا الله إن للموت لسكرات
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhinna li ‘lmawti la’sakarāt.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, surely death has agonies.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/144. The Hadith also mention him using the Siivak (tooth stick). Hisnul Muslim 151

duas.subtitle: Instruction for the one nearing death
duas.ar_dua:
لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وَاللّهُ أَكْبَـر
 لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ 
لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ لا شَريكَ لهُ 
لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ لهُ المُلكُ ولهُ الحَمْد 
لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وَلا حَـوْلَ وَلا قُـوَّةَ إِلاّ بِالله
duas.transliteration:
Lā ilāha illallāhwallāhu Akbar. 
lā ilāha illallāhu waḥdah. 
lā ilāha illallāhwaḥdahu lā sharīka lah. 
lā ilāha illallāhlahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamd. 
lā ilāha illallāhwa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh.
duas.en_translation:
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Allah is the Most Great. 
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone. 
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. 
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, His is the dominion and His is the praise. 
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, there is no power and no might but by Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/317. Hisnul Muslim 152

duas.subtitle: For one afflicted by a calamity
duas.ar_dua: 'لا إله إلا الله' دخل الجنة
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh
duas.en_translation: Whoever dies with the last words (whose meaning is): "There is none worthy of worship but Allah" will enter Paradise.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 3/190. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/432. Hisnul Muslim 153

duas.subtitle: When closing the eyes of the deceased
duas.ar_dua:
إِنّا للهِ وَإِنَا إِلَـيْهِ راجِعـون 
 
اللهُـمِّ اْجُـرْني في مُصـيبَتي وَاخْلُـفْ لي خَيْـراً مِنْـها
duas.transliteration:
Innā lillāhi wa innā ilayhi rāji`ūn. 

Allāhumma-jurni fī muṣībatīwa 'khluf lī khayran minhā.
duas.en_translation:
We are from Allah and unto Him we return. 

O Allah take me out of my plight and bring to me after it something better.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/632. Hisnul Muslim 154

duas.subtitle: For the deceased at the funeral prayer #1
duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ اغْفِـرْ لِـفلان (باسـمه) وَارْفَعْ دَرَجَتَـهُ في المَهْـدِييـن  وَاخْـلُفْـهُ في عَقِـبِهِ في الغابِـرين وَاغْفِـرْ لَنـا وَلَـهُ يا رَبَّ العـالَمـين وَافْسَـحْ لَهُ في قَبْـرِهِ وَنَـوِّرْ لَهُ فيه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir li (name of the person) warfa` darajatahu fi ‘l-mahdiyyīn. wakhlufhu fī `aqibihi fi ‘l-ghābirīn. wagh’fir-lanā wa lahu yā Rabba ‘l-`ālamīn. wafsaḥ lahu fī qabrihi wa nawwir lahu fīh.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive [name of the person] and elevate his station among those who are guided. Send him along the path of those who came before, and forgive us and him, O Lord of the worlds. Enlarge for him his grave, and shed light upon him in it.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/634. Hisnul Muslim 155

duas.subtitle: For the deceased at the funeral prayer #2
duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ اغْفِـرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْـه  وَعافِهِ وَاعْفُ عَنْـه  وَأَكْـرِمْ نُزُلَـه  وَوَسِّـعْ مُدْخَـلَه  وَاغْسِلْـهُ بِالْمـاءِ وَالثَّـلْجِ وَالْبَـرَدْ  وَنَقِّـهِ مِنَ الْخطـايا كَما نَـقّيْتَ الـثَّوْبَ الأَبْيَـضَ مِنَ الدَّنَـسْ  وَأَبْـدِلْهُ داراً خَـيْراً مِنْ دارِه  وَأَهْلاً خَـيْراً مِنْ أَهْلِـه  وَزَوْجَـاً خَـيْراً مِنْ زَوْجِه  وَأَدْخِـلْهُ الْجَـنَّة  وَأَعِـذْهُ مِنْ عَذابِ القَـبْر [وَعَذابِ النّـار]
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir lahu warḥamh. wa `āfihi, wa`fu `anh. wa akrim nuzulah. wa wassi` mudkhalah. wagh’silhu bi ‘lmā'i wath-thalji walbarad. wa naqqihi mina ‘l-khaṭāyākamā naqqaytath-thawba ‘l-abyaḍa minad-danas. wa abdilhu dāran khayran min dārih. wa ahlan khayran min ahlih. wa zawjan khayran min zawjih. wa adkhilhu ‘l-jannah. wa a`idhhu min `adhābi ‘l-qabri [wa `adhābin-nār].
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him, and give him strength and pardon him. Be generous to him, and cause his entrance to be wide, and wash him with water and snow and hail. Cleanse him of his transgressions as white cloth is cleansed of stains. Give him an abode better than his home, and a family better than his family, and a wife better than his wife. Take him into Paradise, and protect him from the punishment of the grave [and from the punishment of Hell-fire].
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/663. Hisnul Muslim 156

duas.subtitle: For the deceased at the funeral prayer #3
duas.ar_dua:
اللهُـمِّ اغْفِـرْ لِحَيِّـنا وَمَيِّتِـنا وَشـاهِدِنا وَغائِبِـنا  وَصَغيـرِنا وَكَبيـرِنا  وَذَكَـرِنا وَأُنْثـانا

 اللهُـمِّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْـتَهُ مِنّا فَأَحْيِـهِ عَلى الإِسْلام  وَمَنْ تَوَفَّـيْتَهُ مِنّا فَتَوَفَّـهُ عَلى الإِيـمان
 
 اللهُـمِّ لا تَحْـرِمْنـا أَجْـرَه  وَلا تُضِـلَّنا بَعْـدَه
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma’ghfir liḥayyinā, wa mayyitinā. wa shāhidinā, wa ghā'ibinā. wa ṣaghīrinā wa kabīrinā. wa dhakarinā wa unthānā. 

Allāhumma man aḥyaytahu minnāfa aḥyihi `ala ‘l-Islām. wa man tawaffaytahu minnāfatawaffahu `alal-īmān. 

Allāhumma lā taḥrimnā ajrahwa lā tuḍillanā ba`dah.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah forgive our living and our dead, those who are with us and those who are absent, our young and our old, our menfolk and our womenfolk. 

O Allah, whomever you give life from among us give him life in Islam, and whomever you take away from us take him away in Faith. 

O Allah, do not forbid us their reward and do not send us astray after them.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn Majah 1/480, Ahmad 2/368. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251. Hisnul Muslim 157

duas.subtitle: For the deceased at the funeral prayer #4
duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ إِنَّ فُلانَ بْنَ فُلانٍ في ذِمَّـتِك  وَحَبْـلِ جِـوارِك  فَقِـهِ مِنْ فِتْـنَةِ الْقَـبْرِ وَعَذابِ النّـار  وَأَنْتَ أَهْلُ الْوَفـاءِ وَالْـحَقِّ  فَاغْفِـرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْـهُ  إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَـفورُ الـرَّحيم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma inna [name the person] fī dhimmatik. wa ḥabli jiwārik. faqihi min fitnati ‘l-qabri wa `adhābin-nār. wa anta ahlu ‘l-wafā'i wa ‘l-ḥaqq. Faghfir lahu warḥamhinnaka anta ‘l-Ghafūrur-Raḥīm.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, surely [name the person] is under Your protection, and in the rope of Your security, so save him from the trial of the grave and from the punishment of the Fire. You fulfill promises and grant rights, so forgive him and have mercy on him. Surely You are Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud 3/211. See also Al Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251. Hisnul Muslim 158

duas.subtitle: When the deceased is a child, during the funeral prayer #1
duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ عَبْـدُكَ وَابْنُ أَمَـتِك احْتـاجَ إِلى رَحْمَـتِك وَأَنْتَ غَنِـيٌّ عَنْ عَذابِـه إِنْ كانَ مُحْـسِناً فَزِدْ في حَسَـناتِه وَإِنْ كانَ مُسـيئاً فَتَـجاوَزْ عَنْـه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma `abduka wabnu 'amatikiḥtāja ilā raḥmatik. wa anta ghaniyyun `an `adhābih. in kāna muḥsinan fazid fī ḥasanātih. wa in kāna musī'an fatajāwaz `anh.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Your male slave and the child of Your female slave is in need of Your mercy, and You are not in need of his torment. If he was pious then increase his rewards and if he was a transgressor then pardon him.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Hakim 1/359 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him. See also Al-Albani, Ahkamul-Jana'iz, p. 125. Hisnul Muslim 159

duas.subtitle: When the deceased is a child, during the funeral prayer #2
duas.ar_dua:
اللهم أعذه من عذاب القبر '
 وإن قال: 'اللهم اجعله فرطاً وذخراً لوالديه  وشفيعاً مجاباً .
 اللهم ثقل به موازينها وأعظم به أجورهما  وألحقهُ بصالح المؤمنين  واجعلهُ في كفالة إبراهيم  وقه برحمتك عذاب الجحيم  وأبدله داراً خيراً من داره  وأهلاً خيراً من أهله  
اللهم اغفر لاسلافنا  وأفراطنا  ومن سبقنا بالإيمان ' فحسن
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma a`idh’hu min `adhābi ‘l-qabr[or say:] 
Allāhumma ‘j`alhu faraṭan wa dhukhran liwālidayh. wa shafī`an mujāban. 
Allāhumma thaqqil bihi mawāzīnahumāwa a`ẓim bihi ujūrahumā. wa alḥiqhu biṣāliḥi ‘l-mu'minīn. waj`alhu fī kafālati Ibrāhīm. wa qihi biraḥmatika `adhāba ‘l-jaḥīm. wa abdilhu dāran khayran min dārih. wa ahlan khayran min ahlih. 
Allāhumma’ghfir li aslāfinā wa afrāṭināwa man sabaqanā bil īmān.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, protect him from the torment of the grave.
[It is also good to say:] O Allah, make him a precursor, a forerunner and a treasure for his parents and an answered intercessor. 
O Allah, make him weigh heavily in their scales (of good) and magnify their reward. Make him join the righteous of the believers. Place him in the care of Ibrahim. Save him by Your mercy from the torment of Hell. Give him a home better than his home, and a family better than his family. 
O Allah, forgive those who have gone (i. e. passed away) before us, our children lost (by death), and those who have preceded us in Faith.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn Qudamah, Al-Mughni 3/416 and Ad-Duroosul-Muhimmah li-Aammatil-'Ummah, pg. 15, by Shaikh 'Abdul-'Aziz bin Baz. Hisnul Muslim 160

duas.subtitle: Condolence
duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ اجْعَلْـهُ لَنا فَرَطـاً وَسَلَـفاً وَأَجْـراً
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’j`alhu lanā faraṭan, wa salafan, wa ajra.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, make him for us a precursor, a forerunner and a cause of reward.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Hasan (Al-Basri) used to recite Surat Al-Fatihah for a child's funeral and then say this. Al-Bukhari, Kitabul-Jana'iz, p. 65. Hisnul Muslim 161

duas.subtitle: Placing the deceased in the grave
duas.ar_dua: 'إن لله ما أخذ وله ما أعطى . وكل شيء عنده بأجل مُسمى ... فلتصبر ولتحتسب ' وإن قال : 'أعظم الله أجرك  وأحسن عزاءك وغفر لميتك' فحسن
duas.transliteration: Inna lillāhi mā akhadh. wa lahu mā a`tā. wa kullu shay'in `indahu bi ajalin musammā... faltaṣbir wa ‘l-taḥtasib.[Also good to say:]A`ẓamallāhu ajrak. wa 'aḥsana `azā'ak. wa ghafara limayyitik.
duas.en_translation: Surely, Allah takes what is His, and what He gives is His, and to all things He has appointed a time... so have patience and be rewarded.^1 May Allah magnify your reward, and make perfect your bereavement, and forgive your departed. ^2
duas.en_reference: Reference: ^1 Al-Bukhari 2/80, Muslim 2/636. ^2 An-Nawawi, Kitabul-'Athkar, p. 126. Hisnul Muslim 162

duas.subtitle: After burying the deceased
duas.ar_dua: بِسْـمِ اللهِ وَعَلـى سُـنَّةِ رَسـولِ الله
duas.transliteration: Bismillāhwa `alā sunnati Rasūlillāh.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah, and according to the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 3/314 with an authentic chain. Ahmad also recorded it with the wording: With the Name of Allah, and according to the religion of the Messenger of Allah. Its chain is also authentic. Hisnul Muslim 163

duas.subtitle: Visiting the graves
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ اللَّهُمَّ ثَبِّتْهُ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir lahAllāhumma thabbit’h.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive him. O Allah, strengthen him.
duas.en_reference: Reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to stop after burying the dead and say to the people: "Ask Allah to forgive your brother and pray for him to be strengthened, for indeed he is now being questioned." Abu Dawud 3/315, and Al-Hakim 1/370 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed. Hisnul Muslim 164

duas.subtitle: During a wind storm #1
duas.ar_dua: السَّلامُ عَلَـيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيارِ مِنَ المؤْمِنيـنَ وَالْمُسْلِمين وَإِنّا إِنْ شاءَ اللهُ بِكُـمْ لاحِقـون نَسْـاَلُ اللهَ لنـا وَلَكُـمْ العـافِيَة
duas.transliteration: Assalāmu `alaykum ahlad-diyāri minal-mu'minīna wa ‘l-muslimīn. wa innā in shā' Allāhu bikum lāḥiqūnnas'alullāha lanā wa lakumul-`āfiyah.
duas.en_translation: Peace be upon you, people of this abode, from among the believers and those who are Muslims, and we, by the Will of Allah, shall be joining you. [May Allah have mercy on the first of us and the last of us] I ask Allah to grant us and you well-being.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/671, Ibn Majah 1/494, the portion brackets is from Muslim 2/671. Hisnul Muslim 165

duas.subtitle: During a wind storm #2
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنَّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَيْـرَها وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّها
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahā. wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for the good of it, and seek refuge in You against its evil.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/326, Ibn Majah 2/1228. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/305. Hisnul Muslim 166

duas.subtitle: Upon hearing thunder
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنَّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَيْـرَها وَخَيْـرَ ما فيهـا وَخَيْـرَ ما اُرْسِلَـتْ بِه وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّها وَشَـرِّ ما فيهـا وَشَـرِّ ما اُرْسِلَـتْ بِه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahā. wa khayra mā fīhā. wa khayra mā ursilat bih. wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihā. wa sharri mā fīhā. wa sharri mā ursilat bih.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for the good of it, for the good of what it contains, and for the good of what is sent with it. I seek refuge in You from the evil of it, from the evil of what it contains, and from the evil that is sent with it.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/616, Al-Bukhari 4/76. Hisnul Muslim 167

duas.subtitle: For rain #1
duas.ar_dua: سُبْـحانَ الّذي يُسَبِّـحُ الـرَّعْدُ بِحَمْـدِهِ وَالملائِكـةُ مِنْ خيـفَته
duas.transliteration: Subḥāna ‘l-ladhī yusabbiḥur-ra`du bi ḥamdihiwa ‘l-malā'ikatu min khīfatih.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to Him Whom thunder and angels glorify due to fear of Him.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Whenever Abdullah bin Zubair (RA) would hear thunder, he would abandon all conversation and say this supplication. See Al-Muwatta' 2/992. It was graded authentic by Al-Albani as a statement of Abdullah bin Zubayr only. Hisnul Muslim 168

duas.subtitle: For rain #2
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ اسْقِـنا غَيْـثاً مُغيـثاً مَريئاً مُريـعاً نافِعـاً غَيْـرَ ضار عاجِـلاً غَـيْرَ آجِل
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ‘asqinā ghaythan mughīthan marī'an murī`a, nāfi`an ghayra ḍārr, `ājilan ghayra ājil.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, shower upon us abundant rain, beneficial not harmful, swiftly and not delayed.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 1/303. See also Al-Albani SahihAbu Dawud 1/216. Hisnul Muslim 169

duas.subtitle: For rain #3
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ أغِثْنـا اللّهُمَّ أغِثْنـا اللّهُمَّ أغِثْنـا
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma aghithnā, Allāhumma aghithnā, Allāhumma aghithnā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, send us rain. O Allah, send us rain. O Allah, send us rain.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 2/613. Hisnul Muslim 170

duas.subtitle: When it rains
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ اسْقِ عِبادَكَ وَبَهـائِمَك وَانْشُـرْ رَحْمَـتَكَ وَأَحْيِي بَلَـدَكَ المَيِّـت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’sqi `ibādaka wa bahā'imak. wanshur raḥmatak. wa aḥyi baladaka ‘l-mayyit
duas.en_translation: O Allah, give water to Your slaves, and Your livestock, and spread Your mercy, and revive Your dead land.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 1/305. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/218. Hisnul Muslim 171

duas.subtitle: After rainfall
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ صَيِّـباً نافِـعاً
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ṣayyiban nāfi`a.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, (bring) beneficial rain clouds.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/518. Hisnul Muslim 172

duas.subtitle: Asking for clear skies
duas.ar_dua: مُطِـرْنا بِفَضْـلِ اللهِ وَرَحْمَـتِه
duas.transliteration: Muṭirnā bifaḍlillāhi wa raḥmatih.
duas.en_translation: We have been given rain by the grace and mercy of Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/205, Muslim 1/83. Hisnul Muslim 173

duas.subtitle: Upon sighting the crescent moon
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ حَوالَيْنا وَلا عَلَيْـنا اللّهُمَّ عَلى الآكـامِ وَالظِّـراب وَبُطـونِ الأوْدِية وَمَنـابِتِ الشَّجـر
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ḥawālaynā wa lā `alaynā. Allāhumma `ala ‘l-ākāmi waẓ-ẓirāb. wa buṭūni ‘l-awdiyati, wa manābitish-shajar.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, let the rain fall around us and not upon us, O Allah, (let it fall) on the pastures, hills, valleys, and the roots of trees.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 1/614 Hisnul Muslim 174

duas.subtitle: Upon breaking fast #1
duas.ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْـبَر اللّهُمَّ أَهِلَّـهُ عَلَيْـنا بِالأمْـنِ وَالإيمـان والسَّلامَـةِ والإسْلام وَالتَّـوْفيـقِ لِما تُحِـبُّ رَبَّنـا وَتَـرْضـى رَبُّنـا وَرَبُّكَ الله
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar. Allāhumma ahillahu `alayna bi ‘l-amni wa ‘l-īmān. was-salāmati wa ‘l-'Islām. wat-tawfīqi limā tuḥibbu Rabbanā wa tarḍā. Rabbunā wa Rabbukallāh.
duas.en_translation: Allah is the Most Great. O Allah, bring us the new moon with security and Faith, with peace and in Islam, and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/157. Hisnul Muslim 175

duas.subtitle: Upon breaking fast #2
duas.ar_dua: ذَهَـبَ الظَّمَـأُ وَابْتَلَّـتِ العُـروق وَثَبَـتَ الأجْـرُ إِنْ شـاءَ الله
duas.transliteration: Dhahabaẓ-ẓama'. wabtallati ‘l-`urūq. wa thabata ‘l-'ajru in shā Allāh.
duas.en_translation: The thirst is gone, the veins are moistened, and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209. Hisnul Muslim 176

duas.subtitle: Before eating #1
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنَّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ بِرَحْمَـتِكَ الّتي وَسِـعَت كُلَّ شيء أَنْ تَغْـفِرَ لي
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'alukabi raḥmatika ‘l-latī wasi`at kulla shay'an taghfira lī.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things, that You forgive me.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn Majah 1/557 from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh graded it as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul- Athkar 4/342. Hisnul Muslim 177

duas.subtitle: Before eating #2
duas.ar_dua: بسمِ اللَّهِ فِي أَوَّلِهِ وَآخِرِهِ
duas.transliteration: When anyone of you begins eating, say:Bismillāh. And if you forget then when you remember, say:Bismillāhi fī awwalihi wa ākhirih.
duas.en_translation: When anyone of you begins eating, say: With the Name of Allah. And if you forget then, when you remember, say: With the Name of Allah, in the beginning, and in the end.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 3/347, At-Tirmidhi 4/288. See Al- Albani's Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/167. Hisnul Muslim 178

duas.subtitle: Upon completing the meal #1
duas.ar_dua: 'اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ' 'اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ وَزِدْنَا مِنْهُ'
duas.transliteration: Whomever Allah has given food, should say:Allāhumma bārik lanā fīhi. wa aṭ`imnā khayran minh. Whomever Allah has given milk to drink, should say :Allāhumma bārik lanā fīhi. wa zidnā minh.
duas.en_translation: Whomever Allah has given food, should say: O Allah, bless us in it and provide us with better than it. Whomever Allah has given milk to drink, should say: O Allah, bless us in it and give us more of it.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/506. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/158. Hisnul Muslim 179

duas.subtitle: Upon completing the meal #2
duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْـدُ للهِ الَّذي أَطْعَمَنـي هـذا وَرَزَقَنـيهِ مِنْ غَـيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلا قُوَّة
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillāhi ‘l-ladhī aṭ`amanī hādhā. wa razaqanīhi min ghayri ḥawlin minnī wa lā quwwah.
duas.en_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has given me this food, and sustained me with it though I was unable to do it and powerless.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/159. Hisnul Muslim 180

duas.subtitle: Of the guest for the host
duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْـدُ للهِ حَمْـداً كَثـيراً طَيِّـباً مُبـارَكاً فيه غَيْرَ مَكْفِيٍّ وَلا مُوَدَّعٍ وَلا مُسْتَغْـنىً عَنْـهُ رَبَّـنا
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillāhi ḥamdan kathīran tayyiban mubārakan fīh. ghayra makfiyyin wa lā muwadda`in. wa lā mustaghnan `anhu Rabbanā.
duas.en_translation: All praise is to Allah, praise in abundance, good and blessed. It cannot [be compensated for, nor can it] be left, nor can it be done without, our Lord.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 6/214, At-Tirmidhi 5/507. Hisnul Muslim 181

duas.subtitle: To one who intends to give food or drink
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ بارِكْ لَهُمْ فيما رَزَقْـتَهُم وَاغْفِـرْ لَهُـمْ وَارْحَمْهُمْ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma bārik lahum fī mā razaqtahum. wagh’fir lahum warḥamhum.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, bless them in what You have provided for them, and forgive them and have mercy on them.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 3/1615. Hisnul Muslim 182

duas.subtitle: When breaking fast in someone’s home
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ أَطْعِمْ مَن أَطْعَمَني وَاسْقِ مَن سقاني
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma aṭ`im man aṭ`amanīwasqi man saqānī.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, feed the one who has fed me, and give drink to the one who has given me drink.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 3/126. Hisnul Muslim 183

duas.subtitle: By one fasting when presented with food and does not break his fast
duas.ar_dua: أَفْطَـرَ عِنْدَكُم الصّـائِمونَ وَأَكَلَ طَعامَـكُمُ الأبْـرار وَصَلَّـتْ عَلَـيْكُمُ الملائِكَـة
duas.transliteration: Afṭara `indakumuṣ-ṣā'imūn. wa akala ṭa`āmakumu ‘l-'abrār. wa ṣallat `alaykumu ‘l-malā'ikah.
duas.en_translation: With you, those who are fasting have broken their fast, you have fed those who are righteous, and the angels recite their prayers upon you.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 3/367, Ibn Majah 1/556, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah 296-8. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/730. Hisnul Muslim 184

duas.subtitle: When insulted while fasting #1
duas.ar_dua: (إِذَا دُعِيَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيُجِبْ فَإِنْ كَانَ صَائِماً فَلْيُصَلِّ وَإِنْ كَانَ مُفْطِراً فَلْيَطْعَمْ) وَمَعْنَى فَلْيُصَلِّ أَيْ فَلْيَدْعُ.
duas.en_translation: When you are invited (to eat) then reply to the invitation. If you are fasting then invoke Allah's blessings (on your host), and if you are not fasting then eat.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/1054. Hisnul Muslim 185

duas.subtitle: When insulted while fasting #2
duas.ar_dua: إِنِّي صَائِمٌ إِنِّي صَائِمٌ
duas.transliteration: Innī ṣā'im. innī ṣā'im.
duas.en_translation: I am fasting. I am fasting.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-BAri 4/103, Muslim 2/806. Hisnul Muslim 186

duas.subtitle: Upon seeing the early or premature fruit
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ بارِكْ لَنا في ثَمَـرِنا وَبارِكْ لَنا في مَدينَتِنـا وَبارِكْ لَنا في صاعِنـا وَبارِكْ لَنا في مُدِّنا
duas.transliteration: Allahumma bārik lanā fī thamarinā. wa bārik lanā fī madīnatināwa bārik lanā fī ṣā`inā. wa bārik lanā fī muddinā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, bless us in our dates and bless us in our town, bless us in our Sa' and in our Mudd.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/1000 (Sa' and Mudd are both dry measures used for agricultural produce by the Arabs in the Prophet's time. Of the two, the So.' was the larger measure.) (Translator) Hisnul Muslim 187

duas.subtitle: Upon sneezing
duas.ar_dua:
إِذَا عَطَسَ أَحَدُكُم فَلْيَقُلِ  (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ) 

وَلْيَقُلْ لَهُ أَخُوهُ أَوْ صَاحِبُهُ:  (يَرْحَمُكَ اللَّهُ)

 فَإِذَا قَالَ لَهُ: (يَرحَمُكَ اللَّهُ) 
فَلْيَقُلْ:  (يَهْدِيكُمُ اللَّهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ)
duas.transliteration:
When you sneeze, say: Alḥamdulillāh

Your companion should say: Yarḥamukallāh

When someone says Yarḥamukallāh to you then you should say: Yahdīkumu ‘llāhu wa yuṣliḥu bālakum.
duas.en_translation:
When you sneeze, then say: All praises and thanks are to Allah. 

Your companion should say: May Allah have mercy upon you. 

When someone says Yarḥamukallāh to you then you should say: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/125. Hisnul Muslim 188

duas.subtitle: When a disbeliever praises Allah after sneezing
duas.ar_dua: يَهْـديكُـمُ اللهُ وَيُصْـلِحُ بالَـكُم
duas.transliteration: Yahdīkumullāhu wa yuṣliḥu bālakum.
duas.en_translation: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/82, Ahmad 4/400, Abu Dawud 4/ 308. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/354. Hisnul Muslim 189

duas.subtitle: To the newlywed
duas.ar_dua: بارَكَ اللّهُ لَك وَبارَكَ عَلَـيْك وَجَمَعَ بَيْـنَكُما في خَـيْر
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu lak. wa bāraka `alayk. wa jama`a baynakumā fī khayr.
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and join you together in goodness.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/316. Hisnul Muslim 190

duas.subtitle: On the wedding night or when buying an animal
duas.ar_dua:
إِذَا تَزَوَّجَ أَحَدُكُمُ امْرَأَةً أَوْ إِذَا اشْتَرَى خَادِماً فَلْيَقُلْ: 
 (اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَشَرِّ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ)وَإِذَا اشْتَرَى بَعِيراً فَلْيَأْخُذْ 
بِذِرْوَةِ سَنَامِهِ وَلْيَقُلْ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ.
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahāwa khayra mā jabaltahā `alayh. wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihāwa sharri mā jabaltahā `alayh.
duas.en_translation: When any of you marries a woman or purchases a maid-servant then let him say: O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of her, and the goodness upon which You have created her, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of her, and from the evil upon which You have created her. If you purchase a camel then take hold of the top of its hump and say the same.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/248 and Ibn Majah 1/617. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/324. Hisnul Muslim 191

duas.subtitle: Before sexual intercourse with the wife
duas.ar_dua: بِسْمِ الله اللّهُـمَّ جَنِّبْنا الشَّيْـطانَ وَجَنِّبِ الشَّـيْطانَ ما رَزَقْـتَنا
