duas.transliteration: Bismillāh. Allāhumma jannibnash-Shayṭān. wa jannibish-Shayṭāna mā razaqtanā.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah. O Allah, keep the Devil away from us, and keep the Devil away from that which You provide for us.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 6/141, Muslim 2/1028. Hisnul Muslim 192

duas.subtitle: When angry
duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِاللهِ مِنَ الشَّيْـطانِ الرَّجيـم
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāhi minash-Shayṭānir-rajīm.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/99, Muslim 4/2015. Hisnul Muslim 193

duas.subtitle: Upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation
duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْـدُ للهِ الّذي عافاني مِمّا ابْتَـلاكَ بِهِ وَفَضَّلَـني عَلى كَثيـرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَـقَ تَفْضـيلا
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillāhi ‘l-ladhī `āfānī mimmab-talāka bihiwa faḍḍalanī `alā kathīrin mimman khalaqa tafḍīlā.
duas.en_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with, and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/493,4. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/153. Hisnul Muslim 194

duas.subtitle: At a sitting or gathering
duas.ar_dua: عن ابن عمر قال : كان يعد لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم في المجلس الواحد مائة مرة من قبل أن يقوم 'رب اغفر لي وتب علي إنك أنت التواب الغفور
duas.transliteration: Rabbigh’fir līwa tub `alayyinnaka antat-Tawwābu ‘l-Ghafūr.
duas.en_translation: Ibn Umar (ra) said: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to repeat in a single sitting: My Lord, forgive me, and accept my repentance, You are the Ever-Relenting, the All-Forgiving.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sahih Ibn Majah 2/321. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/153. Hisnul Muslim 195

duas.subtitle: For the expiation of sins, said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering
duas.ar_dua: سُبْحـانَكَ اللّهُـمَّ وَبِحَمدِك أَشْهَـدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ أَنْتَ أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتوبُ إِلَـيْك
duas.transliteration: Subhānaka Allāhumma wa biḥamdik. ash-hadu an lā ilāha illā ant. astaghfiruka wa atību ilayk.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise is to You. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi and An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/ 153. Aishah (RA) said: "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) did not sit in a gathering, and did not recite the Qur'an, and did not perform any prayer without concluding by saying ... (then she quoted the above)." This was reported by An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no.308), and Dr. Farooq Hamadah graded it authentic in his checking of the same book, p. 273. See also Ahmad 6/77 Hisnul Muslim 196

duas.subtitle: Returning a supplication of forgiveness
duas.ar_dua: وَلَكَ
duas.transliteration: Walaka
duas.en_translation: And you.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 5/82, and An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 218, with checking by Dr. Farooq Hamadah. Hisnul Muslim 197

duas.subtitle: To one who does you a favour
duas.ar_dua: جَزاكَ اللهُ خَـيْراً
duas.transliteration: Jazākallāhu khayra.
duas.en_translation: May Allah reward you with good.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi (no. 2035). See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/200 and Sahihul-Jami' (no. 6244). Hisnul Muslim 198

duas.subtitle: Protection from the Dajjal
duas.ar_dua: .(مَنْ حَفِظَ عَشْرَ آيَاتٍ مِنْ أَوَّلِ سُورَةِ الْكَهْفِ عُصِمَ مِنَ الدَّجَّالِ) وَالْاسْتِعَاذَةُ بِاللَّهِ مِنْ فِتْنَتِهِ عَقِبَ التَّشَهُّدِ الْأَخِيرِ مِنْ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ.
duas.en_translation:
Whoever memorizes ten 'Ayat (Verses) from the beginning of Surat Al-Kahf, will be protected from the False Messiah1
if he recites in every prayer after the final Tashahhud before ending the prayer, seeking the protection of Allah from the trials of the False Messiah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: 1 Muslim 1/555, another version mentions the last ten 'Ayat, Muslim 1/556. 2 See invocations no. 55 and 56 of this book. Hisnul Muslim 199

duas.subtitle: To one who pronounces his love for you, for Allah’s sake
duas.ar_dua: أَحَبَّـكَ الّذي أَحْبَبْـتَني لَه
duas.transliteration: Aḥabbaka ‘lladhī aḥbabtanī lah.
duas.en_translation: May He for Whose sake you love me, love you.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/333. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/965. Hisnul Muslim 200

duas.subtitle: To one who has offered you some of his wealth
duas.ar_dua: بارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ في أَهْلِكَ وَمالِك
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu laka fī ahlika wa mālik.
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you in your family and your property.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-BAri 4/88. Hisnul Muslim 201

duas.subtitle: To the debtor when his debt is settled
duas.ar_dua: بارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ في أَهْلِكَ وَمالِك إِنَّما جَـزاءُ السَّلَفِ الْحَمْدُ والأَداء
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu laka fī ahlika wa mālik. innamā jazā'us-salafi ‘l-ḥamdu wa‘l-adā'.
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth, surely the reward for a loan is praise and returning (what was borrowed).
duas.en_reference: Reference: An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylahp. 300, Ibn Majah 2/809. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah2/55. Hisnul Muslim 202

duas.subtitle: For fear of shirk
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنّـي أَعـوذُبِكَ أَنْ أُشْـرِكَ بِكَ وَأَنا أَعْـلَمْ وَأَسْتَـغْفِرُكَ لِما لا أَعْـلَم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika an ushrika bika wa anā a`lam. wa astaghfiruka limā lā a`lam.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I associate anything with You knowingly, and I seek Your forgiveness for what I know not.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 4/403. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 3/233 and Sahihut-Targhib wat- Tarhib 1/19. Hisnul Muslim 203

duas.subtitle: To someone who says "May Allah bless you"
duas.ar_dua: وَفيكَ بارَكَ الله
duas.transliteration: Wafīka bārakallāh.
duas.en_translation: And may Allah bless you.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn As-Sunni, p. 138, (no. 278). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Al-Wdbil As-Sayyib, p. 304, with checking by Basheer Muhammad ?Uyoon. Hisnul Muslim 204

duas.subtitle: The scorn of ascribing things to evil omens
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ لا طَيْـرَ إِلاّ طَيْـرُك وَلا خَـيْرَ إِلاّ خَـيْرُك وَلا إِلهَ غَيْـرُك
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma lā ṭayra illā ṭayruk. wa lā khayra illā khayruk. wa lā ilāha ghayruk.
duas.en_translation: O Allah there is no portent other than Your portent, no goodness other than Your goodness, and none worthy of worship other than You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 2/220, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 292). See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadlth As-Sahihah 3/54, (no. 1065). As for bodings of good, these used to please the Prophet (ﷺ) and so when he heard good words from someone, he used to say: "We have taken from you a good portent from your mouth," Abu Dawud, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/363, and it is with Abu Ash-Shaikh Al-Asfahani in 'Akhlaqun-Nabiyy, pg. 270. Hisnul Muslim 205

duas.subtitle: When mounting an animal or any means of transport
duas.ar_dua:
بِسْـمِ اللهِ وَالْحَمْـدُ لله

 سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ * وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ

 الحَمْـدُ لله الحَمْـدُ لله الحَمْـدُ لله
 اللهُ أكْـبَر اللهُ أكْـبَر اللهُ أكْـبَر 

سُـبْحانَكَ اللّهُـمَّ إِنّي ظَلَـمْتُ نَفْسي فَاغْـفِرْ لي فَإِنَّهُ لا يَغْفِـرُ الذُّنوبَ إِلاّ أَنْـت
duas.transliteration:
Bismillāh. walḥamdulillāh. 

Subḥāna ‘lladhī sakhkhara lanā hādhāwa mā kunnā lahu muqrinīn. Wa innā ilā Rabbinā lamunqalibūn. 

Alḥamdulillāh, alḥamdulillāh, alḥamdulillāh. 
Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar. 

Subḥānaka ‘llāhumma innī ẓalamtu nafsī. faghfir lī. fa innahu lā yaghfirudh-dhunūba illā ant.
duas.en_translation:
With the Name of Allah. Praise is to Allah. 

Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us though we could never have had it by our efforts. Surely, unto our Lord, we are returning. 

Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. 
Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. 

Glory is to You. O Allah, I have wronged my own soul. Forgive me, for surely none forgives sins but You.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 3/34, At-Tirmidhi 5/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi3/156. Hisnul Muslim 206

duas.subtitle: For travel
duas.ar_dua:
اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ 

سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ * وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ

 اللَّهُمَّ إِنّا نَسْأَلُكَ فِي سَفَرِنَا هَذَا البِرَّ وَالتَّقْوَى وَمِنَ الْعَمَلِ مَا تَرْضَى 

اللَّهُمَّ هَوِّنْ عَلَيْنَا سَفَرَنَا هَذَا وَاطْوِ عَنَّا بُعْدَهُ 

اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الصَّاحِبُ فِي السَّفَرِ وَالْخَليفَةُ فِي الْأَهْلِ 

اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ وَعْثَاءِ السَّفَرِ وَكَآبَةِ الْمَنْظَرِ وَسُوءِ الْمُنْقَلَبِ فِي الْمَالِ وَالْأَهْلِ' 

وإذا رَجَعَ قَالَهُنَّ وَزَادَ فِيهِنَّ: 'آيِبُونَ تائِبُونَ عَابِدُونَ لِرَبِّنَا حَامِدُونَ'
duas.transliteration:
Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar. 

Subḥāna ‘l-ladhi sakhkhara lanā hādhā wa mā kunnā lahu muqrinīn. Wa innā ilā Rabbinā lamunqalibūn. 

Allāhumma innā nas'aluka fī safarinā hādha ‘l-birra wat-taqwā. Wa mina ‘l-`amali mā tarḍā. 

Allāhumma hawwin `alaynā safaranā hādhā waṭwi `annā bu`dah. 

Allāhumma antas-sāḥibu fis-safar. wa ‘l-khalīfatu fil-ahl. 

Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika min wa`thā'is-safar.  wa ka'ābati ‘l-manẓar. wa sū'il-munqalabi fil-māli wa ‘l-ahl.

(Upon returning recite the same again adding) Ā’ibūna, tā'ibūna, `ābidūn. Li Rabbinā ḥāmidūn.
duas.en_translation:
Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. 

Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us though we could never have had it by our efforts. Surely, unto our Lord we are returning. 

O Allah, we ask You on this our journey for goodness and piety, and for works that are pleasing to You. 

O Allah, lighten this journey for us and make its distance easy for us. 

O Allah, You are our Companion on the road and the One in Whose care we leave our family. 

O Allah, I seek refuge in You from this journey's hardships, and from the wicked sights in store and from finding our family and property in misfortune upon returning. 

(Upon returning recite the same again adding) We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord, and praising our Lord.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/978. Hisnul Muslim 207

duas.subtitle: Upon entering a town or village
duas.ar_dua:
أللّـهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّـمواتِ السّـبْعِ وَما أَظْلَلَـن وَرَبَّ الأَراضيـنَ السّـبْعِ وَما أقْلَلْـن وَرَبَّ الشَّيـاطينِ وَما أَضْلَلْـن وَرَبَّ الرِّياحِ وَما ذَرَيْـن 

أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَيْـرَ هذهِ الْقَـرْيَةِ وَخَيْـرَ أَهْلِـها وَخَيْـرَ ما فيها وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّها وَشَـرِّ أَهْلِـها وَشَـرِّ ما فيها
duas.transliteration:
Allāhumma Rabbas-samāwātis-sab`i wa mā aẓlaln. Wa Rabba ‘l-arāḍīnas-sab`i wa mā aqlaln. wa Rabbash-shayāṭīni wa mā aḍlaln. wa Rabbar-riyāḥi wa mā dharayn. 

As'aluka khayra hādhihi ‘l-qaryah. wa khayra ahlihā. wa khayra māfīhā. wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihā. wa sharri ahlihā. wa sharri mā fīhā.
duas.en_translation:
O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and all they overshadow, Lord of the seven worlds and all they uphold, Lord of the devils and all they lead astray, Lord of the winds and all they scatter. 

I ask You for the goodness of this town, and for the goodness of its people, and for the goodness it contains. I seek refuge in You from its evil, from the evil of its people, and from the evil it contains.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tfaahabi agreed 2/100, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 524). Al-Hafidh graded it good in his checking of Al-'Athkdr 5/154. Ibn Baz said in Tuhfatul-'Akhydr p. 37, that An-Nasa'i recorded it with a good chain of narration. Hisnul Muslim 208

duas.subtitle: When entering the market
duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّه وحدَهُ لا شريكَ لهُ لهُ المُلْـكُ ولهُ الحَمْـد يُحْيـي وَيُميـتُ وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لا يَمـوت بِيَـدِهِ الْخَـيْرُ وَهوَ على كلّ شيءٍ قدير
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhwaḥdahu lā sharīka lah. Lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamd. Yuḥyī wa yumīt. wa huwa ḥayyun lā yamūt. Biyadihi ‘l-khayr. wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr.
duas.en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is living and does not die. In His Hand is all good, and He is Able to do all things.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/291, and Al-Hakim 1/538. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Ibn Majah 2/21 and Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152. Hisnul Muslim 209

duas.subtitle: When the mounted animal (or mean of transport) stumbles
duas.ar_dua: بِسْـمِ اللهِ
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/296. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/941. Hisnul Muslim 210

duas.subtitle: Supplication of the traveller for the resident
duas.ar_dua: أَسْتَـوْدِعُكُـمُ اللَّهَ الَّذي لا تَضـيعُ وَدائِعُـه
duas.transliteration: Astawdi`ukumu ‘llāha ‘l-ladhi lā taḍī`u wadā'i`uh.
duas.en_translation: I place you in the trust of Allah, whose trust is never misplaced.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 2/403, Ibn Majah 2/943. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/133. Hisnul Muslim 211

duas.subtitle: Supplication of the resident for the traveller #1
duas.ar_dua: أَسْتَـوْدِعُ اللَّهَ ديـنَكَ وَأَمانَتَـكَ وَخَـواتيـمَ عَمَـلِك
duas.transliteration: Astawdi`ullāha dīnak. wa amānatak. wa khawātīma `amalik.
duas.en_translation: I leave your religion in the care of Allah, as well as your safety, and the last of your deeds.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 2/7, At-Tirmidhi 5/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/155. Hisnul Muslim 212

duas.subtitle: Supplication of the resident for the traveller #2
duas.ar_dua: زَوَّدَكَ اللَّهُ التقْوى وَغَفَـرَذَنْـبَكَ وَيَسَّـرَ لَكَ الخَـيْرَ حَيْـثُما كُنْـت
duas.transliteration: Zawwadaka ‘llāhut-taqwā. wa ghafara dhanbak. wa yassara laka ‘l-khayra ḥaythu mā kunt.
duas.en_translation: May Allah give you piety as your provision, forgive your sins, and make goodness easy for you wherever you are.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi, 3/155. Hisnul Muslim 213

duas.subtitle: Takbir and Tasbih during travel
duas.ar_dua: قَالَ جَابِرٌ رضي الله عنه: (كُنَّا إِذَا صَعَدْنَا كَبَّرْنَا وَإِذَا نَزَلْنَا سَبَّحْنَا)
duas.en_translation: Jabir (ra), said: Whenever we went up a hill we would say Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) and when we descended we would say Subḥānallāh (Glory is to Allah).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/135. Hisnul Muslim 214

duas.subtitle: Prayer of the traveller as dawn approaches
duas.ar_dua: سَمِـعَ سـامِعٌ بِحَمْـدِ اللهِ وَحُسْـنِ بَلائِـهِ عَلَيْـنا. رَبَّنـا صـاحِبْـنا وَأَفْـضِل عَلَيْـنا عائِذاً باللهِ مِنَ النّـار
duas.transliteration: Sami`a sāmi`un biḥamdillāhi wa ḥusni balā'ihi `alaynā. Rabbanā ṣāḥibnā, wa afḍil `alaynā,`ā'idhan billāhi minan-nār.
duas.en_translation: He Who listens has heard that we praise Allah for the good things He gives us. Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us. I seek the protection of Allah from the Fire.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2086, the meaning of sami`a sāmi`un (who listens has heard) is that 'a witness has witnessed our praise of Allah due to His blessings and favor upon us.' It could also be read samma`a sāmi`un, in which case it means 'one who has heard this statement of mine will convey it to another and he will say it as well.' This is due to the attention given to the Thikr (remembrance of Allah) and supplications made during the early morning hours. The meaning of his saying 'Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us' is: 'Our Lord, protect us and guard us. Bless us with Your numerous bounties, and avert from us every evil.' See An-Nawawi, Sharh Sahih Muslim 17/39. Hisnul Muslim 215

duas.subtitle: Stopping or lodging somewhere in travel and otherwise
duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِكَلِـماتِ اللّهِ التّـامّاتِ مِنْ شَـرِّ ما خَلَـق
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti min sharri mā khalaq.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2080. Hisnul Muslim 216

duas.subtitle: While returning from travel
duas.ar_dua:
[يُكَبِّرُ عَلَى كُلِّ شَرَفٍ ثَلاَثَ تَكْبِيرَاتٍ]
ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: 

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ 
آيِبُونَ تَائِبُونَ عَابِدُونَ لِرَبِّنا حَامِدُونَ صَدَقَ اللَّهُ وَعْدَهُ وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزابَ وَحْدَهُ
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah. lahu ‘l-mulku, walahu ‘l-ḥamd. wa Huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr, ā'ibūna, tā'ibūna,`ābidūn, li Rabbinā ḥāmidūn, sadaqallāhu wa`dah, wa nasara `abdah. wa hazama ‘l-'aḥzāba waḥdah.
duas.en_translation:
From every elevated point say Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) three times 

and then recite: 
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. 
We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord, and praising our Lord. He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated the Confederates.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Bukhari 7/163, Muslim 2/980. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say this when returning from a campaign or from Hajj. Hisnul Muslim 217

duas.subtitle: What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news
duas.ar_dua:
كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ الْأَمْرُ يَسُرُّهُ قَالَ: 
(الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ)
وَإِذَا أَتَاهُ الْأَمْرُ يَكْرَهُهُ قَالَ: 
(الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ)
duas.transliteration: Alḥamdu lillāhi ‘lladhi bi ni`matihi tatimmuṣ-ṣāliḥāt. Alḥamdu lillāhi `alā kulli ḥāl.
duas.en_translation:
When something happened that pleased him, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say:
Praise is to Allah Who by His blessings all good things are perfected.
And if something happened that displeased him, he used to say:
Praise is to Allah in all circumstances.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ibn As-Sunni, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic 1/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/201. Hisnul Muslim 218

duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) #1
duas.ar_dua:
قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم: 

(مَنْ صَلَّى عَلَيَّ صَلاَةً صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ بِهَا عَشْراً)
duas.en_translation:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 

“Whoever prays for Allah's blessings upon me once, will be blessed for it by Allah ten times."
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 1/288. Hisnul Muslim 219

duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) #2
duas.ar_dua:
وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: 

(لاَ تَجْعَلُوا قَبْرِي عِيداً وَصَلُّوا عَلَيَّ فَإِنَّ صَلاَتَكُم تَبْلُغُنِي حَيْثُ كُنْتُمْ)
duas.en_translation:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 

“Do not make my grave a place of ritual celebration, but pray for Allah's blessings upon me, for your blessings reach me from wherever you are.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/218, Ahmad 2/367. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/383. Hisnul Muslim 220

duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) #3
duas.ar_dua:
وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم:

 (الْبَخِيلُ مَنْ ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيَّ)
duas.en_translation:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 

“The miser is the one in whose presence I am mentioned yet does not pray for Allah's blessings upon me."
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/551 and others. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/177 and Sahihul-Jarai' As-Saghir 3/25. Hisnul Muslim 221

duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) #4
duas.ar_dua:
وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم:

(إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَلاَئِكَةً سَيَّاحِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يُبَلِّغُونِي مِنْ أُمَّتِي السَّلاَمَ)
duas.en_translation:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 

“Indeed Allah has angels who roam the earth and they convey to me the greetings (or prayers of peace) of my Ummah (nation)."
duas.en_reference: Reference: An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim 2/421. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/274. Hisnul Muslim 222

duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) #5
duas.ar_dua:
وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم:

(مَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ يُسَلِّمُ عَلَيَّ إِلاَّ رَدَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيَّ رُوحِيَ حَتَّى أَرُدَّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلاَمَ)
duas.en_translation:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 

“No one sends greetings (or prayers of peace) upon me but Allah returns my soul to me so that I may return his greetings."
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud (no. 2041). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/383. Hisnul Muslim 223

duas.subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #1
duas.ar_dua:
قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم:

 (لاَ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوا وَلاَ تُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا أَوَلاَ أَدُلُّكُم عَلَى شَيْءٍ إِذَا فَعَلْتُمُوهُ تَحَابَبْتُم أَفْشُوا السَّلاَمَ بَيْنَكُمْ)
duas.en_translation:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 

“You shall not enter Paradise until you believe, and you have not believed until you love one another. Shall I tell you of something you can do to make you love one another? Spread the greetings of Salam (peace) amongst yourselves (i. e. between each other).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 1/74 and others. Hisnul Muslim 224

duas.subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #2
duas.ar_dua: ثَلاَثٌ مَنْ جَمَعَهُنَّ فَقَدْ جَمَعَ الْإِيمَانَ: الْإِنْصَافُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ وَبَذْلُ السَّلاَمِ لِلْعَالَمِ وَالْإِنْفَاقُ مِنَ الإِقْتَارِ
duas.en_translation: Three characteristics, whoever combines them, has completed his faith: to be just, to spread greetings to all people and to spend (charitably) out of the little you have.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/82 as a statement of the Companion 'Ammar (RA). Hisnul Muslim 225

duas.subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #3
duas.ar_dua: وَعَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمَا: أنَّ رَجُلاً سَأَلَ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أيُّ الْإِسْلاَمِ خَيْرٌ قَالَ: (تُطْعِمُ الطَّعَامَ وَتَقْرأُ السَّلاَمَ عَلَى مَنْ عَرَفْتَ وَمَنْ لَمْ تَعْرِفْ)
duas.en_translation: `Abdullah bin `Umar (RA) said: A man asked the Prophet (ﷺ), "What is the best act of Islam?" He said, "To feed others and to give greetings of Salam (peace) to those whom you know and to those whom you do not know. "
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/55, Muslim 1/65. Hisnul Muslim 226

duas.subtitle: Returning a greeting to a disbeliever
duas.ar_dua: إذَا سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ فَقُولُوا:  وَعَلَيْكُمْ
duas.transliteration: If one of the People of the Scripture (i.e., Christians and Jews) greets you saying As-Salaamu alaykum, then say (to him): 'Wa alaykum' And upon you .
duas.en_translation: If one of the People of the Scripture (i. e. Christians and Jews) greets you saying As-Salaamu `alaykum, then say (to him): And upon you .
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/42, Muslim 4/1705. Hisnul Muslim 227

duas.subtitle: Upon hearing a rooster crow or the braying of a donkey
duas.ar_dua: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ صِيَاحَ الدِّيَكَةِ فَاسْأَلُوا اللَّهَ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ فَإِنَّهَا رَأَتْ مَلَكاً وَإِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نَهِيقَ الْحِمَارِ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ فَإِنَّهُ رَأَى شَيْطَاناً
duas.en_translation: When you hear the cock's crow, ask Allah for His favor upon you for surely it has seen an angel. When you hear the bray of a donkey, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, for surely it has seen a devil.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/350, Muslim 4/2092. Hisnul Muslim 228

duas.subtitle: Upon hearing the barking of dogs at night
duas.ar_dua: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نُبَاحَ الْكِلاَبِ وَنَهِيقَ الْحَمِيرِ بِاللَّيْلِ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنْهُنَّ فَإِنَّهُنَّ يَرَيْنَ مَا لاَ تَرَوْنَ
duas.en_translation: When you hear a dog barking or a donkey braying in the night, then seek refuge in Allah from them, for surely they have seen what you see not.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 4/327, Ahmad 3/306. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/961. Hisnul Muslim 229

duas.subtitle: For one you have insulted
duas.ar_dua: قال صلى الله عليه وسلم:'اللَّهُم فأيما مؤمن سببته فاجعل ذلك له قربة إليك يوم القيامة'
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma fa'ayyumā mu'minin sababtuhufaj`al dhālika lahu qurbatan ilayka yawma ‘l-qiyāmah.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, whomever of the believers I have abused, give him the reward of a sacrificial slaughter for it on the Day of Resurrection.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/171, Muslim 4/2007. The wording in Muslim's report is: 'make it a purification for him and a source of mercy. Hisnul Muslim 230

duas.subtitle: The etiquette of praising a fellow Muslim
duas.ar_dua: قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَحْسِبُ فُلاَناً وَاللَّهُ حَسِيبُهُ وَلاَ أُزَكِّي عَلَى اللَّهِ أَحَداً أَحْسِبُهُ – إِنْ كَانَ يَعْلَمُ ذَاكَ – كَذَا وَكَذَا'
duas.transliteration: Aḥsibu fulānan wallāhu ḥasībuhwa lā uzakkī `alallāhi aḥada.
duas.en_translation: If any of you praises his companion then let him say: I consider (such and such a person), and Allah is his Assessor, (meaning: and I cannot claim anyone to be pious before Allah) if you know of this (good character trait in the person) to be such and such (saying what he thinks is praiseworthy in that person).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2296. Hisnul Muslim 231

duas.subtitle: For the one that have been praised
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنِي بِمَا يَقُولُونَ وَاغْفِرْ لِي مَا لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ [وَاجْعَلْنِي خَيْرًا مِمَّا يَظُّنُّونَ]
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma lā tu'ākhidhnī bimā yaqūlūn. waghfir lī mā lā ya`lamūn[waj`alnī khayran mimmā yaẓunnūn].
duas.en_translation: O Allah, do not call me to account for what they sayand forgive me for what they have no knowledge of[and make me better than they imagine].
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adabul-Mufrad no. 761. See Al-Albani, Sahih Al-'Adabul-Mufrad (no. 585). The portion between brackets if from Al-Bayhaqi, Shu'ab Al-Iman 4/228, and comes another account. Hisnul Muslim 232

duas.subtitle: The Talbiya for the one doing Hajj or Umrah
duas.ar_dua: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ لَبَّيْكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ والنِّعْمَة لَكَ والمُلْكُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ
duas.transliteration: Labbayk-Allāhumma labbayk. labbayka lā sharīka laka labbayk. inna ‘l-ḥamda, wanni`mata, laka wa ‘l-mulk. lā sharīka lak.
duas.en_translation: I am here at Your service, O Allah, I am here at Your service. I am here at Your service, You have no partner, I am here at Your service. Surely the praise, and blessings are Yours, and the dominion. You have no partner.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/408, Muslim 2/841. Hisnul Muslim 233

duas.subtitle: The Takbîr passing the black stone
duas.ar_dua: طَافَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِالْبَيْتِ عَلَى بَعِيرٍ كُلَّمَا أَتَى الرُّكْنَ أَشَارَ إِلَيْهِ بِشَيْءٍ عِنْدَهُ وَكَبَّرَ
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) performed Tawaf riding a camel. Every time he passed the corner (containing the Black Stone), he would point to it with something that he was holding and say: Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great)!
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/476. See also 472. The 'something' that was referred to in this Hadith was a cane. Hisnul Muslim 234

duas.subtitle: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone
duas.ar_dua: ﴿رَبَّنَا آتِنَا في الدُّنْيَا حسَنَةً وفي الآخِرَةِ حسَنةً وقِنَا عذَابَ النَّارِ﴾
duas.transliteration: Rabbanā ātinā fid-dunyā ḥasanahwa fi ‘l-ākhirati ḥasanahwa qinā `adhāban-nār.
duas.en_translation: Our Lord, grant us the good things in this world, and the good things in the next life, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/179, Ahmad 3/411, Al-Baghawi, Sharhus-Sunnah 7/128. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/354. The Ayat is from Surat Al-Baqarah, 2:201. Hisnul Muslim 235

duas.subtitle: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah
duas.ar_dua:
(لَمَّا دَنَا النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِنَ الصَّفَا قَرَأَ: 
 إِنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَآئِرِ اللَّهِ
 'أَبْدَأُ بِمَا بَدَأَ اللَّهُ بِهِ’
 فَبَدَأَ بِالصَّفَا فَرَقِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى رَأَى الْبَيْتَ 

فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ فَوَحَّدَ اللَّهَ وَكبَّرَهُ وَقَالَ:  إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ 
وَحْدَهُ أَنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُثُمَّ دَعَا بَيْنَ ذلكَ.
 
قَالَ مِثْلَ هَذَا ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ) الْحَدِيثُ. 

 وَفِيهِ: (فَفَعَلَ عَلَى الْمَرْوَةِ كَمَا فَعَلَ عَلَى الصَّفَا))
duas.transliteration:
Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite: 
Innaṣ-Ṣafā wa ‘l-Marwata min sha`ā'irillāh. Abda'u bimā bada'allāhu bih.He began (his Sa`y) at Mount Safa climbing it, until he could see the House. 

He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words: 
Lā ilāha illallāh, Allāhu Akbar

Then he said: 
Lā ilāha 'illallāhwaḥdahu lā sharīka lah. Lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamdwa Huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr. lā 'ilāha illallāhu waḥdahu, anjaza wa`dahu, wa naṣara `abdahu, wa hazama ‘l 'aḥzāba waḥdah.

Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same three times. 

He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.
duas.en_translation:
Surely Safa and Marwah are among the signs of Allah. 
I begin by that which Allah began. 

He began (his Sa'y) at Mount Safa climbing it until he could see the House. 

He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words: 
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great. 

Then he said: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated Confederates. 

Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same thing like this three times. 

He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/888. Hisnul Muslim 236

duas.subtitle: The Day of Arafah
duas.ar_dua: خير الدعاء دعاء يوم عرفة وخيرُ ما قلت أنا والنبيُّون من قبلي :  لا إله إلا الله وحدهُ لا شريك لهُ  لهُ الملكُ ولهُ الحمدُ وهو على كل شيء قدير.
duas.transliteration: Lā 'ilāha 'illallāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lahu. lahul-mulku wa lahul-ḥamdu wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/184, and also Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 4/6. Hisnul Muslim 237

duas.subtitle: Remembrance at Muzdalifa
duas.ar_dua: رَكِبَ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْقَصْوَاءَ حَتَّى أَتَى الْمَشْعَرَ الْحَرَامَ فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ (فَدَعَاهُ وَكَبَّرَهُ وَهَللَّهُ وَوَحَّدَهُ) فَلَمْ يَزَلْ وَاقِفاً حَتَّى أَسْفَرَ جِدَّاً فَدَفَعَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَطْلُعَ الشَّمسُ.
duas.en_translation: He (ﷺ) rode Al-Qaswa until he reached Al-MashAAar Al-Haram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.'
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 2/891. Hisnul Muslim 238

duas.subtitle: Takbir when throwing each pebble at the Jamarat
duas.ar_dua: يُكَبِّرُ كُلَّمَا رَمَى بِحَصَاةٍ عِنْدَ الْجِمَارِ الثَّلاَثِ ثُمَّ يَتَقَدَّمُ ويَقِفُ يَدْعُو مُسْتَقْبِلَ الْقِبلَةِ رَافِعاً يَدَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْجَمْرَةِ الْأُولَى وَالثَّانِيَةِ. أَمَّا جَمْرَةُ الْعَقَبَةِ فَيَرْمِيهَا وَيُكَبِّرُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ وَيَنْصَرِفُ وَلاَ يَقِفُ عِنْدَهَا
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) with each pebble he threw at the three pillars. Then he went forward, stood facing the Qiblah, and raised his hands and called upon Allah. That was after (stoning) the first and second pillars. As for the third, he stoned it and called out Allāhu Akbar with every pebble he threw, but when he was finished he left without standing at it (for supplications).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/581, 3, 4, and Muslim Hisnul Muslim 239

duas.subtitle: At times of amazement and that which delights #1
duas.ar_dua: سُـبْحانَ الله
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāh!
duas.en_translation: (Glory is to Allah).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/210, 390, 414 and Muslim 4/1857. Hisnul Muslim 240

duas.subtitle: At times of amazement and that which delights #2
duas.ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْـبَر
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar!
duas.en_translation: (Allah is the Most Great)
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/441. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/103, 235, Ahmad 5/218. Hisnul Muslim 241

duas.subtitle: Upon receiving pleasant news
duas.ar_dua: كَانَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ أَمْرٌ يَسُرُّهُ أَوْ يُسَرُّ بِهِ خَرَّ سَاجِداً شُكْراً لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَتَعَالَى
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ), upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure, would prostrate in gratitude to Allah blessed and exalted.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/233, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 2/226. Hisnul Muslim 242

duas.subtitle: When feeling some pain in the body
duas.ar_dua: ضَعْ يَدَكَ عَلَى الَّذِي تَألَّمَ مِنْ جَسَدِكَ وَقُلْ: 'بِسْمِ اللَّهِ' ثَلاَثاً وَقُلْ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ: 'أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ'
duas.transliteration: Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say: Bismillāh (three times).Then say seven times: A`ūdhu billāhi wa qudratihi min sharri mā ajidu wa uḥādhir.
duas.en_translation: Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say: With the Name of Allah (three times). Then say seven times: I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/1728. Hisnul Muslim 243

duas.subtitle: When in fear of afflicting something with an (evil) eye from oneself
duas.ar_dua: إِذَا رَأَى أَحَدُكُم مِنْ أَخِيهِ أَوْ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ أَوْ مِنْ مَالِهِ مَا يُعْجِبُهُ [فَلْيَدْعُ لَهُ بِالْبَرَكَةِ] فَإِنَّ الْعَيْنَ حَقٌّ
duas.en_translation: If you see something from your brother, yourself or wealth which you find impressing, then invoke blessings for it, for the evil eye is indeed true.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 4/447, Ibn Majah, Malik. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/212. Also see Al-Arna'ut's checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad 4/170. Hisnul Muslim 244

duas.subtitle: When startled
duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh!
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah!
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/181, Muslim 4/2208. Hisnul Muslim 245

duas.subtitle: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice
duas.ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ [اللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَلَكَ] اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنِّي
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh wallāhu Akbar [Allāhumma minka wa lak] Allāhumma taqabbal minnī.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah, Allah is the Most Great![O Allah, from You and to You.] O Allah, accept it from me.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 3/ 1557, Al-Bayhaqi 9/287. Hisnul Muslim 246

duas.subtitle: To ward off the plot of the rebellious devils
duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُهُنَّ بَرٌّ ولَا فَاجرٌ مِنْ شّرِّ مَا خَلقَ وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُجُ فيهَا ومِن شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ في الأَرْضِ ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ اللَّيْلِ والنَّهارِ ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طارِقٍ إِلَّا طَارِقاً يَطْرُقُ بخَيْرٍ يَا رَحْمَنُ
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti ‘llatī lā yujāwizuhunna barrun wa lā fājirunmin sharri mā khalaq. wa bara'a wa dhara'. wa min sharri mā yanzilu minas-samā'. wa min sharri mā ya`ruju fīhā. wa min sharri mā dhara'a fi ‘l-arḍ. wa min sharri ma yakhruju minhā. wa min sharri fitani ‘llayli wannahār. wa min sharri kulli ṭāriqinillā ṭāriqan yaṭruqu bikhayryā Rahmān.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah -which neither the upright nor the corrupt may overcome -from the evil of what He created, of what He made, and of what He scattered, from the evil of what descends from theheavens, and of what rises up to them, from the evil of what He scattered in the earth, and of what emerges from it, from the evil trials of night and day, and from the evil of every night visitor, except the night visitor who comes with good. O Merciful One.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 637). Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of Al-'Aqidah At-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127. Hisnul Muslim 247

duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #1
duas.ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم: 'وَاللَّهِ إِنِّي لأَسْتَغفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْيَوْمِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةٍ'
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "By Allah, I seek the forgiveness of Allah, and repent to Him more than seventy times in a day.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101. Hisnul Muslim 248

duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #2
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَإِنِّي أَتُوبُ فِي الْيَوْمِ إِلَيْهِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ)
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O people, repent to Allah, for I verily repent to Him one hundred times a day.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2076. Hisnul Muslim 249

duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #3
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الْعَظيمَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ القَيّوُمُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيهِ) غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ.
duas.transliteration: Astaghfirullāha ‘l-'Aẓīmalladhi lā ilāha illā huwa ‘l-ḥayyul-Qayyūmwa atūbu ilayh.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, Whoever says: I seek the forgiveness of Allah the Mighty, Whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Living, the Eternal, and I repent to Him.  Allah will forgive him even if he has deserted the army's ranks.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud 2/85, At-Tirmidhi 5/569, and Al-Hakim who declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/511. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/182. See also Jami'ul-'Usool li-'Ahdaith Ar-Rasool 4/ 389-90 checked by Al-Arna'ut. Hisnul Muslim 250

duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #4
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الرَّبُّ مِنَ الْعَبْدِ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ الآخِرِ فَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَنْ تَكُونَ مِمَّنْ يَذْكُرُ اللَّهَ فِي تِلْكَ السَّاعَةِ فَكُنْ
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The closest that the Lord comes to the slave is in the last portion of the night. So, if you are able to be among those who remember Allah in this hour, then be among them."
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144. Hisnul Muslim 251

duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #5
duas.ar_dua: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ رَبِّهِ وَهُوَ سَاجِدٌ فَأَكثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The closest that the slave comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so invoke Allah much (in prostration)."
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 1/350. Hisnul Muslim 252

duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #6
duas.ar_dua: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: إِنَّهُ لَيُغَانُ عَلَى قَلْبِي وَإِنِّي لأَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ فِي الْيَوْمِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It is a heavy thing for my heart if I do not seek Allah's forgiveness a hundred times a day."
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (ﷺ) was always vigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot to do any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind, he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek the forgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386. Hisnul Muslim 253

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #1
duas.ar_dua: قَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ  (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) فِي يَوْمٍ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ حُطَّتْ خَطَايَاهُ وَلَوْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْر
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdihi.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says: Glorified is Allah and praised is He. one hundred times a day, will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 91 of this book. Hisnul Muslim 254

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #2
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ  (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ) عَشْرَ مِرَارٍ كَانَ كَمَنْ أَعْتَقَ أَرْبَعَةَ أَنْفُسٍ مِنْ وَلَدِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhwaḥdahu lā sharīka lah. lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamdwa huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. ten times, will have the reward for freeing four slaves from the Children of Isma'il.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/67, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 93 of this book. Hisnul Muslim 255

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #3
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الْمِيزَانِ حَبِيبَتَانِ إِلَى الرَّحْمَنِ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) (سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ)
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdih.Subḥānallāhi ‘l-`Aẓīm.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One: Glorified is Allah and praised is He, Glorified is Allah the Most Great.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2072. Hisnul Muslim 256

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #4
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: لَأَنْ أَقُولَ  (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ) أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ الشَّمسُ.
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāh. walḥamdu lillāh. wa lā ilāha illallāh. wallāhu 'Akbar
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: For me to say: Glory is to Allah, and praise is to Allah, and there is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great. is dearer to me than all that the sun rises upon (i.e., the whole world).
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2072. Hisnul Muslim 257

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #5
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَيَعْجِزُ أَحَدُكُم أَنْ يَكْسِبَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ فَسَأَلَهُ سَائِلٌ مِنْ جُلَسَائِهِ كَيْفَ يَكْسِبُ أَحَدُنَا أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ قَالَ: يُسَبِّحُ مِائَةَ تَسْبِيحَةٍ فَيُكتَبُ لَهُ أَلْفُ حَسَنَةٍ أَوْ يُحَطُّ عَنْهُ أَلْفُ خَطِيئَةٍ.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Is anyone of you incapable of earning one thousand Hasanah (rewards) in a day?" Someone from his gathering asked, "How can anyone of us earn a thousand Hasanah?" He said, "Glorify Allah a hundred times and a thousand Hasanah will be written for you, or a thousand sins will be wiped away."
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2073. Hisnul Muslim 258

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #6
duas.ar_dua: مَنْ قَالَ  (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ)غُرِسَتْ لَهُ نَخْلَةٌ فِي الْجَنَّةِ
duas.transliteration: Whoever says: Subḥānallāhi ‘l-'Aẓīmi wa biḥamdih will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.
duas.en_translation: Whoever says: Glorified is Allah the Most Great and praised is He. will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/511, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/531 and Sahih At-Tirmidhi3/160. Hisnul Muslim 259

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #7
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ قَيْسٍ أَلاَ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَى كَنْزٍ مِنْ كُنُوزِ الْجَنَّةِ فَقُلْتُ: بَلَى يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قَالَ: قُلْ  (لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ)
duas.transliteration: Lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata 'illā billāh.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise? "I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." So he told me to say: There is no power and no might except by Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/213, Muslim 4/2076. Hisnul Muslim 260

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #8
duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَحَبُّ الْكَلاَمِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَرْبَعٌ  (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ) وَ(الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ) وَ(لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ) وَ(اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ) لاَ يَضُرُّكَ بِأَيِّهِنَّ بَدَأتَ
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāh Walḥamdu lillāh.Wa lā ilāha illallāhWallāhu Akbar.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four: Glorified is Allah, and The praise is for Allah, and There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great. It doesn't matter which of them you start with.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 3/1685. Hisnul Muslim 261

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #9
duas.ar_dua: جَاءَ أَعْرَابِيٌّ إِلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ: عَلِّمْنِي كَلاماً أَقُولُهُ: قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العَالَمِينَ لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ).قَالَ: فَهَؤُلاَءِ لِرَبِّي فَمَا لِي قَالَ: قُلْ (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَارْحَمْنِي وَاهْدِنِي وَارْزُقْنِي).
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhwaḥdahu lā sharīka lah, Allāhu Akbaru kabīra, walḥamdu lillāhi kathīra, Subḥānallāhi Rabbil-`ālamīn, Lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāhi ‘l-`Azīzil-Hakīm.He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?"  The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to say: Allāhummaghfir lī, warḥamnī, waḥdinī warzuqnī.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Who has no partner, Allah is the Great, the Most Great, and praise is to Allah in abundance, glory is to Allah, Lord of the worlds. There is no power and no might but by Allah the Mighty, the Wise. He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?" The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to say: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me, and provide for me.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2072, Abu Dawud reports the same Hadith with the addition: and when the Arab left, the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "He has filled his hands with goodness." 1/220. Hisnul Muslim 262

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #10
duas.ar_dua: كَانَ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا أَسْلَمَ عَلَّمَهُ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم الصَّلاَةَ ثُمَّ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَدْعُوَ بِهَؤُلاَءِ الْكَلِمَاتِ: (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرِ لِي وَارْحَمْنِي وَاهْدِنِي وَعَافِنِي وَارْزُقْنِي)
duas.transliteration: Allāhummaghfir lī, warḥamnī, waḥdinī, wa `āfinī warzuqnī
duas.en_translation: Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how to pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me and give me good health and provide for me.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Muslim 4/2073, and in one of Muslim's reports there is the addition: 'For these words combine [the goodness of] this world and the next.' Hisnul Muslim 263

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #11
duas.ar_dua: إِنَّ أَفْضَلَ الدُّعَاءِ (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ) وَأَفْضَلَ الذِّكْرِ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)
duas.transliteration: The most excellent invocation is: Alḥamdulillāh and the most excellent words of remembrance are: Lā ilāha illallāh.
duas.en_translation: The most excellent invocation is: Praise is for Allah. and the most excellent words of remembrance are: There is none worthy of worship but Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/462, Ibn Majah 2/1249, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tbahabi agreed 1/503. See Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/362. Hisnul Muslim 264

duas.subtitle: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir #12
duas.ar_dua: الباقيات الصالحات:  (سبحان الله) و(الحمد لله) و(لا إله إلا الله) و(الله أكبر) و (لا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله)
duas.transliteration: The good deeds which endure are: Subḥānallāh. Walḥamdu lillāh. Wa lā ilāha illallāh Wallāhu Akbar Wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh.
duas.en_translation: The good deeds which endure are:  Glorified is Allah, and The praise is for Allah, and There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great, and There is no power and no might except by Allah.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Ahmad (no. 513) (Ahmad Shakir, ed.) and its chain of narration is authentic. See Majma'uz-Zawa'id 1/297. Ibn Hajar mentions it in Bulughul-Maram saying that Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim considered it authentic. Hisnul Muslim 265

duas.subtitle: How the Prophet ﷺ made tasbeeh
duas.ar_dua: عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو رضي الله عنهما قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَعْقِدُ التَّسْبِيحَ بِيَمِينِهِ.
duas.en_translation: Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA) said: "I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) counting the glorification of his Lord on his right hand."
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawud with a different wording 2/81, and At-Tirmidhi 5/521. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 4/271 (no. 4865). Hisnul Muslim 266

duas.subtitle: Comprehensive types of good and manners
duas.ar_dua: إِذَا كَانَ جُنْحُ اللَّيْلِ – أَوْ أَمْسَيْتُم – فَـكُفُّوا صِبْيانَـكُم فَإِنَّ الشَّيَاطِينَ تَنْتَشِرُ حِينَئِذٍ فَإِذَا ذَهَبَ سَاعَةٌ مِنَ اللَّيلِ فَخَلُّوهُمْ وَأَغْلِقُوا الأَبْوَابَ وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّ الشَّيطَانَ لاَ يَفْتَحُ بَاباً مُغلَقاً وَأَوْكُوا قِرَبَكُمْ وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ وَخَمِّرُوا آنِيَتَكُم وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ وَلَوْ أَنْ تَعْرُضُوا عَلَيْهَا شَيْئاً وَأَطْفِئُوا مَصَابِيحَكُمْ.
duas.en_translation: When night falls, restrain your children (from going out) because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention Allah’s name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your water-skins and mention Allah’s name, cover your vessels with anything and mention Allah’s name and put out your lamps.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Bukhari with Al-Fath 10/88 and Muslim 3/1595. Hisnul Muslim 267

duas.subtitle: Dua of Ibrahim (ﷺ) - 1
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلۡ مِنَّآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana taqabbal minnaa innaka Antas Samee’ul Aleem
duas.en_translation: Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Qur’an 2:217

duas.subtitle: Dua of Ibrahim (ﷺ) - 2
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَٱجۡعَلۡنَا مُسۡلِمَيۡنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَآ أُمَّةٗ مُّسۡلِمَةٗ لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبۡ عَلَيۡنَآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana waj’alnaa muslimaini laka wa min zurriyyatinaaa ummatam muslimatal laka wa arinaa manaasikanaa wa tub ‘alainaa innaka antat Tawwaabur Raheem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites [of worship] and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 2:128

duas.subtitle: Dua of Ibrahim (ﷺ) - 3
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلۡحِسَابُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanagh fir lee wa liwaalidaiya wa lilmu’mineena Yawma yaqoomul hisaab
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 14:41

duas.subtitle: Dua of Ibrahim (ﷺ) - 4
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجۡعَلۡنَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا رَبَّنَآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana laa taj’alnaa fitnatal lillazeena kafaroo waghfir lanaa rabbanaaa innaka antal azeezul hakeem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 60:5

duas.subtitle: Dua of Adam (ﷺ)
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa zalamnaaa anfusanaa wa illam taghfir lanaa wa tarhamnaa lanakoonanna minal khaasireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 7:23

duas.subtitle: Dua of Dawood (ﷺ)
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ أَفۡرِغۡ عَلَيۡنَا صَبۡرٗا وَثَبِّتۡ أَقۡدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرۡنَا عَلَى ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana afrigh ‘alainaa sabranw wa sabbit aqdaamanaa wansurnaa ‘alal qawmil kaafireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 2:250

duas.subtitle: Dua of Shu’aib (ﷺ)
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنَنَا وَبَيۡنَ قَوۡمِنَا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡفَٰتِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaf-tah bainana wa baina qawmina bil haqqi wa anta Khairul Fatiheen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 7:89

duas.subtitle: Dua of Musa (ﷺ) - 1
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa afrigh ‘alainaa sabranw wa tawaffanaa muslimeen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You].”
duas.en_reference: Quran 7:126

duas.subtitle: Dua of Musa (ﷺ) - 2
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَآ أَوْ أَن يَطْغَى
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innanaa nakhaafu ai yafruta ‘alainaaa aw ai yatghaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress.”
duas.en_reference: Quran 20:45

duas.subtitle: Dua of Musa (ﷺ) - 3
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ اِنِّىۡ لِمَاۤ اَنۡزَلۡتَ اِلَىَّ مِنۡ خَيۡرٍ فَقِيۡرٌ
duas.transliteration: Rabbi innee limaaa anzalta ilaiya min khairin faqeer
duas.en_translation: My Lord, indeed I am in need of whatever good You would send down to me
duas.en_reference: Quran 28:24

duas.subtitle: Dua of Sulaiman (ﷺ)
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbi awzi’nee an ashkura ni’mata kal lateee an’amta ‘alaiya wa ‘alaa waalidaiya wa an a’mala saalihan tardaahu wa adkhilnee birahmatika fee ‘ibaadikas saaliheen
duas.en_translation: “My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants.”
duas.en_reference: Quran Surah Naml Ayat 19

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 1
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلۡ مِنَّآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana taqabbal minnaa innaka Antas Samee’ul Aleem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:127

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 2
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَٱجۡعَلۡنَا مُسۡلِمَيۡنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَآ أُمَّةٗ مُّسۡلِمَةٗ لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبۡ عَلَيۡنَآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana waj’alnaa muslimaini laka wa min zurriyyatinaaa ummatam muslimatal laka wa arinaa manaasikanaa wa tub ‘alainaa innaka antat Tawwaabur Raheem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites [of worship] and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:128

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 3
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا فِي ٱلدُّنۡيَا حَسَنَةٗ وَفِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ حَسَنَةٗ وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana atina fid dunyaa hasanatanw wa fil aakhirati hasanatanw wa qinaa azaaban Naar
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:201

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 4
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ أَفۡرِغۡ عَلَيۡنَا صَبۡرٗا وَثَبِّتۡ أَقۡدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرۡنَا عَلَى ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana afrigh ‘alainaa sabranw wa sabbit aqdaamanaa wansurnaa ‘alal qawmil kaafireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:250

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 5
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذۡنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوۡ أَخۡطَأۡنَاۚ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana laa tu’aakhiznaaa in naseenaaa aw akhtaanaa
duas.en_translation: Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:286

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 6
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحۡمِلۡ عَلَيۡنَآ إِصۡرٗا كَمَا حَمَلۡتَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِنَاۚ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana wa laa tahmil-‘alainaaa isran kamaa hamaltahoo ‘alal-lazeena min qablinaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:286

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 7
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلۡنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦۖ وَٱعۡفُ عَنَّا وَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا وَٱرۡحَمۡنَآۚ أَنتَ مَوۡلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرۡنَا عَلَى ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana wa laa tuhammilnaa maa laa taaqata lanaa bih; wa’fu ‘annaa waghfir lanaa warhamnaa; Anta mawlaanaa fansurnaa ‘alal qawmil kaafireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 2:286

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 8
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغۡ قُلُوبَنَا بَعۡدَ إِذۡ هَدَيۡتَنَا وَهَبۡ لَنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحۡمَةًۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡوَهَّابُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana laa tuzigh quloobanaa ba’da iz hadaitanaa wa hab lanaa mil ladunka rahmah; innaka antal Wahhaab
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:8

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 9
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ ٱلنَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innaka jaami ‘un-naasil Yawmil laa raibafeeh; innal laaha laa yukhliful mee’aad
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:9

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 10
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innanaaa aamannaa faghfir lanaa zunoobanaa wa qinaa ‘azaaban Naar
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:16

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 11
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا بِمَآ أَنزَلۡتَ وَٱتَّبَعۡنَا ٱلرَّسُولَ فَٱكۡتُبۡنَا مَعَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa aamannaa bimaaa anzalta wattaba’nar Rasoola faktubnaa ma’ash shaahideen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger [i.e., Jesus], so register us among the witnesses [to truth].”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:53

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 12
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِىٓ أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanagh fir lanaa zunoobanaa wa israafanaa feee amrinaa wa sabbit aqdaamanaa wansurnaa ‘alal qawmil kaafireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:147

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 13
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقْتَ هَٰذَا بَٰطِلًا سُبْحَٰنَكَ فَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa maa khalaqta haaza baatilan Subhaanaka faqinaa ‘azaaban Naar
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:191

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 14
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ مَن تُدْخِلِ ٱلنَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُۥ ۖ وَمَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ مِنْ أَنصَارٍ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innaka man tudkhilin Naara faqad akhzai tahoo wa maa lizzaalimeena min ansaar
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire – You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:192

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 15
duas.ar_dua: رَّبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا سَمِعۡنَا مُنَادِيٗا يُنَادِي لِلۡإِيمَٰنِ أَنۡ ءَامِنُواْ بِرَبِّكُمۡ فَـَٔامَنَّاۚ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innanaa sami’naa munaadiyai yunaadee lil eemaani an aaminoo bi Rabbikum fa aamannaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller, calling to faith, [saying], ‘Believe in your Lord,’ and we have believed.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:193

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 16
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا فَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَكَفِّرۡ عَنَّا سَيِّـَٔاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa faghfir lanaa zunoobanaa wa kaffir ‘annaa saiyi aatina wa tawaffanaa ma’al abraar
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die among the righteous.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:193

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 17
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَءَاتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلَىٰ رُسُلِكَ وَلَا تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ ۗ إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa wa aatinaa maa wa’attanaa ‘alaa Rusulika wa laa tukhzinaa Yawmal Qiyaamah; innaka laa tukhliful mee’aad
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 3:194

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 18
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱكْتُبْنَا مَعَ ٱلشَّٰهِدِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa aamannaa faktubnaa ma’ash shaahideen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, we have believed, so register us among the witnesses.”
duas.en_reference: Qur'an 5:83

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 19
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ أَنزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَآئِدَةً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ تَكُونُ لَنَا عِيدًا لِّأَوَّلِنَا وَءَاخِرِنَا وَءَايَةً مِّنكَ ۖ وَٱرْزُقْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa anzil ‘alainaa maaa’idatam minas samaaa’i takoonu lanaa ‘eedal li awwalinaa wa aakhirinaa wa Aayatam minka warzuqnaa wa Anta khairur raaziqeen
duas.en_translation: “O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us, and You are the best of providers.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 5:114

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 20
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa zalamnaaa anfusanaa wa illam taghfir lanaa wa tarhamnaa lanakoonanna minal khaasireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 7:23

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 21
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجۡعَلۡنَا مَعَ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa laa taj’alnaa ma’al qawmiz zaalimeen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 7:47

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 22
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنَنَا وَبَيۡنَ قَوۡمِنَا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡفَٰتِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaf-tah bainana wa baina qawmina bil haqqi wa anta Khairul Fatiheen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 7:89

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 23
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa afrigh ‘alainaa sabranw wa tawaffanaa muslimeen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You].”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 7:126

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 24
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجۡعَلۡنَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ ; وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحۡمَتِكَ مِنَ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
duas.transliteration: 85. Rabbana la taj’alna fitnatal lil-qawmidh-Dhalimeen ; 86. wa najjina bi- Rahmatika minal qawmil kafireen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people. And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.”

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 25
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ مَا نُخْفِى وَمَا نُعْلِنُ ۗ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innaka ta’lamu maa nukhfee wa maa nu’lin; wa maa yakhfaa ‘alal laahi min shai’in fil ardi wa laa fis samaaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 14:38

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 26
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِي ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَآءِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbij ‘alnee muqeemas Salaati wa min zurriyyatee Rabbanaa wa taqabbal du’aaa
duas.en_translation: “My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 14:40

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 27
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلۡحِسَابُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanagh fir lee wa liwaalidaiya wa lilmu’mineena Yawma yaqoomul hisaab
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 14:41

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 28
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ ءَتِنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa aatinaa mil ladunka rahmatanw wa haiyi’ lanaa min amrinaa rashadaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 18:10

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 29
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَآ أَوْ أَن يَطْغَى
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innanaa nakhaafu ai yafruta ‘alainaaa aw ai yatghaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 20:45

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 30
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا وَٱرۡحَمۡنَا وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلرَّـٰحِمِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa aamannaa faghfir lanaa warhamnaa wa Anta khairur raahimeen
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 23:109

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 31
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا إِنَّهَا سَآءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
duas.transliteration:
65. Rabbanas rif ‘annnaa ‘azaaba Jahannama inn ‘azaabahaa kaana gharaamaa 
66. Innahaa saaa’at mustaqarranw wa muqaamaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering; Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence.”

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 32
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا هَبۡ لَنَا مِنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعۡيُنٖ وَٱجۡعَلۡنَا لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa hab lanaa min azwaajinaa wa zurriyaatinaa qurrata a’yuninw waj ‘alnaa lilmuttaqeena Imaamaa
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us a leader [i.e., example] for the righteous.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 25:74

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 33
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana la Ghafurun shakur
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 35:34

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 34
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَسِعۡتَ كُلَّ شَيۡءٖ رَّحۡمَةٗ وَعِلۡمٗا فَٱغۡفِرۡ لِلَّذِينَ تَابُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُواْ سَبِيلَكَ وَقِهِمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa wasi’ta kulla shai’ir rahmatanw wa ‘ilman faghfir lillazeena taaboo wattaba’oo sabeelaka wa qihim ‘azaabal Jaheem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 40:7

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 35
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا وَأَدۡخِلۡهُمۡ جَنَّـٰتِ عَدۡنٍ ٱلَّتِي وَعَدتَّهُمۡ وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنۡ ءَابَآئِهِمۡ وَأَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِهِمۡۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ وَقِهِمُ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِۚ وَمَن تَقِ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ يَوۡمَئِذٖ فَقَدۡ رَحِمۡتَهُۥۚ وَذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ
duas.transliteration:
8. Rabbana wa adhkhilhum Jannati ‘adninil-lati wa’attahum wa man salaha min aba’ihim wa azwajihim wa dhuriyyatihim innaka antal ‘Azizul-Hakim, 

9. waqihimus saiyi’at wa man taqis-saiyi’ati yawma’idhin faqad rahimatahu wa dhalika huwal fawzul-‘Adheem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their forefathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day – You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 40:8-9

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 36
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَانِنَا الَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِالْإِيمَانِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِي قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِينَ اٰمَنُوا
duas.transliteration: Rabbanagh fir lanaa wa li ikhwaani nal lazeena sabqoonaa bil eemaani wa laa taj’al fee quloobinaa ghillalil lazeena aamanoo
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an  59:10

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 37
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٞ رَّحِيمٌ
duas.transliteration: Rabbannaaa innaka Ra’oofur Raheem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 59:10

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 38
duas.ar_dua: رَّبَّنَا عَلَيۡكَ تَوَكَّلۡنَا وَإِلَيۡكَ أَنَبۡنَا وَإِلَيۡكَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaa ‘alaika tawakkalnaa wa ilaika anabnaa wa ilaikal maseer
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 60:4

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 39
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجۡعَلۡنَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا رَبَّنَآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana laa taj’alnaa fitnatal lillazeena kafaroo waghfir lanaa rabbanaaa innaka antal azeezul hakeem
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.”
duas.en_reference: Qur’an 60:5

duas.subtitle: 40 Rabbanas - 40
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَآ أَتۡمِمۡ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَآۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
duas.transliteration: Rabbanaaa atmim lanaa nooranaa waghfir lana innaka ‘alaa kulli shai’in qadeer
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent.”
duas.en_reference: Qur'an 66:8

duas.subtitle: In the morning and evening #11
duas.ar_dua: اللهم إني أعوذ بك من زوال نعمتك، وتحول عافيتك، وفجاءة نقمتك، وجميع سخطك
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a‘udhu bika min zawali ni‘amatika wa tahawwuli ‘afiyatika wa fuja-ati niqmatika wa jami‘i sakhatika
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the withdrawing of Your blessing, and the loss of the well-being that You granted me, and the sudden onset of Your wrath, and anything that may lead to Your displeasure
duas.en_reference: Narrated by Muslim (2739); Riyad as-Salihin 1478

duas.subtitle: Beneficial Knowledge
duas.ar_dua: اَلْلَّهُمَ إِنِّيِ أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ يَكُونَ أَحَدٌ أَسْعَدَ بِمَا عَلَّمْتَنِي مِنِّي، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَكُونَ عِبْرَةً لِغَيْرِي
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a’udhu bika an yakuna ahadun as‘ada bima ‘allamtani minni, wa a’udhu bika an akuna ‘ibratan lighayri
duas.en_translation: O Allah I seek refuge in you that anyone else should take advantage of what you taught me more than myself, and I seek refuge in you from being a lesson for others.
duas.en_reference:
Reference: [Kitab az-Zuhd by Imam Ahmad (1342)]

Shaykhul-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah (رحمه الله) described this tremendous dua:
“It is from the best of duas” [Majmu’ Al-Fatawa (14/307)]

Shaykh Abdur-Razzaq al-Badr said:
“And whoever does not act upon his knowledge and he calls the people to it, then they are happier with his knowledge then him, & whoever does not take a lesson from those were deficient from the people that came before, he will become a lesson for others.” [https://www.al-badr.net/muqolat/2942]

duas.subtitle: Imaan, Knowledge & Guidance
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ إِيمَانًا دَائِمًا، وَعِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَهَدْيًا قَيِّمًا.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni asaluka emaanan daima, wa ‘ilman nafi‘a, wa hadyan qayyima
duas.en_translation: O Allah! I ask you for Abiding Emān, Beneficial knowledge and Upright Guidance.
duas.en_reference:
Reference: [Recorded by Ibn Abi Shaybah in Al-‘Imān #106 1/41 & Musannaf #30364 6/164, Ibn Battah, Al-Ibānah Al-Kubrā Vol. 2 p498. Translation by ilmTest]

Mu‘āwiyyah ibn Qurrah reported that Abū Dardaa (رضي الله عنه) always use to supplicate with these words and then said, “Because there is Emān that is not abiding, Knowledge that is not beneficial, And guidance that is not upright.”

duas.subtitle: Keeping Firm Upon Religion
duas.ar_dua: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِي عَلَى دِينِكَ
duas.transliteration: Yā Muqallibal-qulūb, thabbit qalbī `alā dīnik
duas.en_translation: O Changer of the hearts, make my heart firm upon Your religion
duas.en_reference:
Reference: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 3522. Book 48, Hadith 153 [Authenticated by al-Albanee in al-Jaam’i as-Sagheer 1323/7988] Translation Source: Darusslam Publication of Sunan At-Tirmidhi

Note: 
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: “Unquestionably, in the body there is a lump of flesh; if it is sound, the whole body is sound,and if it is corrupt, the whole body is corrupt, and behold, it is the heart.” [Bukhari and Muslim]. Guidance belongs to Allah alone because He knows the real state of the heart. He has the power to flip the heart of anyone any time, and no one can change a heart that He has covered.

duas.subtitle: Success in the Hereafter
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ أَصْلِحْ لِي دِينِي الَّذِي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي ، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي دُنْيَايَ الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَاشِي ، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي آخِرَتِي الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَادِي وَاجْعَلِ الْحَيَاةَ زِيَادَةً لِي فِي كُلِّ خَيْرٍ وَاجْعَلِ الْمَوْتَ رَاحَةً لِي مِنْ كُلِّ شَرٍّ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma aṣliḥ lī dīn al-lathi huwa ‘iṣmatu amrī, wa aṣliḥ lī dunya-ya al-lati fīhā ma’āshī, wa aṣlih lī ākhirati al-lati fīhā ma’ādī, wa-ja’al al-ḥayāta ziyādatan lī fī kuli khayr, wa-ja’al al-mawta rāḥatan lī min kuli sharr
duas.en_translation: O Allaah, set right my religion, which is the safeguard of my affairs; and set right my world, wherein is my living; and set right my next life, to which is my return, And make life for me an increase in all good and make death a relief for me from every evil
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sahih Muslim Book 17, Hadith 1472

duas.subtitle: Purification of Heart & Soul
duas.ar_dua: اللهم إني أعوذ بك من العجز والكسل، والبخل والهرم، وعذاب القبر، اللهم آت نفسي تقواها، وزكها أنت خير من زكاها، أنت وليها ومولاها، اللهم إني أعوذ بك من علم لا ينفع ومن قلب لا يخشع، ومن نفس لا تشبع، ومن دعوة لا يستجاب لها
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-'ajzi wal-kasali, wal-bukhli wal-harami, wa 'adhabil-qabri. Allahumma ati nafsi taqwaha, wa zakkiha Anta khairu man zakkaha, Anta waliyyuha wa maulaha. Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min 'ilmin la yanfau', wa min qalbin la yakhsha'u, wa min nafsin la tashba'u, wa min da'watin la yustajabu laha
duas.en_translation: O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the inability (to do good), indolence, cowardice, miserliness, decrepitude and torment of the grave. O Allah! Grant me the sense of piety and purify my soul as You are the Best to purify it. You are its Guardian and its Protecting Friend. O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the knowledge which is not beneficial, and from a heart which does not fear (You), and from desire which is not satisfied, and from prayer which is not answered
duas.en_reference:
Reference: Riyad as-Salihin 1479 In-book reference : Book 16, Hadith 15
