Zaid bin Arqam (May Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would supplicate: "Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-'ajzi wal-kasali, wal-bukhli wal-harami, wa 'adhabil-qabri. Allahumma ati nafsi taqwaha, wa zakkiha Anta khairu man zakkaha, Anta waliyyuha wa maulaha. Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min 'ilmin la yanfau', wa min qalbin la yakhsha'u, wa min nafsin la tashba'u, wa min da'watin la yustajabu laha' [O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the inability (to do good), indolence, cowardice, miserliness, decrepitude and torment of the grave. O Allah! Grant me the sense of piety and purify my soul as You are the Best to purify it. You are its Guardian and its Protecting Friend. O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the knowledge which is not beneficial, and from a heart which does not fear (You), and from desire which is not satisfied, and from prayer which is not answered]." [Muslim].

duas.subtitle: Well-being
duas.ar_dua: بسم الله الذي لا يضر مع اسمه شيء في الأرض ولا في السماء وهو السميع العليم،
duas.transliteration: Bismillahil-ladhi la yadurru ma’as-mihi shai’un fil-ardi wa la fis-sama’i, wa Huwas-Sami’ul-‘Alim
duas.en_translation: (In the Name of Allah with Whose Name there is protection against every kind of harm in the earth or in the heaven, and He is the All-Hearing and All- Knowing).
duas.en_reference:
Reference: Abu Dawood, at-Tirmidhi, Riyaad as-Saalihin 1457

‘Uthman bin ‘Affan (May Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, “He who recites three times every morning and evening… nothing will harm him”

duas.subtitle: Protection
duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
duas.transliteration: A’udhu bikalimatil-lahit-tammati min sharri ma khalaq
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of that which He has created
duas.en_reference:
Reference: Sunan Ibn Maajah 3518

It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said: “A scorpion stung a man and he did not sleep all the night. It was said to the Prophet (ﷺ): ‘So- and-so was stung by a scorpion and he did not sleep all the night.’ He said: ‘If he had said, last night: A’udhu bikalimatil-lahit-tammati min sharri ma khalaq (I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of that which He has created), the scorpion sting would not have harmed him, until morning.’”

duas.subtitle: Increase in Wealth & Offspring
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ أَكْثِرْ مَالَهُ وَوَلَدَهُ، وَبَارِكْ لَهُ فِيمَا أَعْطَيْتَهُ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma 'aksir malee wa waladee, wa barik lee feema a' tay-ta-nee
duas.en_translation: O Allah! increase his wealth and offspring, and bless (for him) what ever you give him
duas.en_reference: Reference : Sahih al-Bukhari 6334 In-book reference : Book 80, Hadith 31

duas.subtitle: Increase in wealth and offspring #1
duas.ar_dua: اَللَّهُمَّ أكْثِرْ مَالِي، وَوَلَدِي، وَبَارِكْ لِي فِيمَا أعْطَيْتَنِي.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma 'aksir malee wa waladee, wa barik lee feema a' tay-ta-nee
duas.en_translation: O Allah, increase my wealth and offspring, and bless me in what You have given me.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sahih al-Bukhari 6380, 6381 In-book reference : Book 80, Hadith 76

duas.subtitle: Increase in wealth and offspring #2
duas.ar_dua: أُعِيذُكُمَا بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّةِ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ وَهَامَّةٍ، وَمِنْ كُلِّ عَيْنٍ لاَمَّةٍ
duas.transliteration: U'izukuma bikalimatil-lahit-tammati min kulli shaytanin wa hammah, wa min kulli 'ainin lammah.
duas.en_translation: “I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allah from every devil and every beast, and from every envious blameworthy eye.”

duas.subtitle: Increase in wealth and offspring #3
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
duas.transliteration: Rabbana hab lana min azwajinaa wa zurriyyatina qurrata a’yunin waj-alnaa lil muttaqiina imaama.
duas.en_translation: “Our Lord! Bless us with pious spouses and offspring who will be the joy of our hearts, and make us models for the righteous.”
duas.en_reference: Reference: Qur’an Surah Al-Furqan, 25:74

duas.subtitle: Increase in wealth and offspring #4
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbi hab lii minas-solihiin.
duas.en_translation: “My Lord! Bless me with righteous offspring.”
duas.en_reference: Reference: Qur’an Surah As-Saffat, 37:100

duas.subtitle: Increase in wealth and offspring #5
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِي ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbij-’alni muqimas-solati wa min zurriyyati, Rabbana wa taqabbal du’aa.
duas.en_translation: “My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.”
duas.en_reference: Reference: Qur’an Surah Ibrahim, 14:40

duas.subtitle: Women for Marriage
duas.ar_dua: اَلّلهُمّ ارْزُقْنِي اِمْرَأةً تَسُرُّنِي إذَا نَظَرْتُ ، وَ تُطِيعُنِي إذَا أَمَرْتُ، وَ تَحْفَظُنِي إذَا غِبْتُ
duas.transliteration: Allahummar-zuqni imratan tasur-runi idha nadhartu wa tuti’uni idha amartu wa tahfadhni idha ghibtu
duas.en_translation: “O Allāh! Provide me with a woman that will make me happy when I look at her, obeys me when I command her and protects me (i.e., my honor and property) when I am absent.”
duas.en_reference: Reference: [Bahjat ul-Majālis wa Unsul Mu’jālis, 183 of Al-Imām ibn Abdil-Barr (may Allāh have mercy on him)]

duas.subtitle: Refuge from Weakness, Laziness, Cowardice, Miserliness, Senility, Humiliation, Poverty & more
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ العَجْزِ، والكَسَلِ، والجُبْنِ، والبُخْلِ، والهَرَمِ، والقَسْوَةِ، والغَفْلَةِ، والعَيْلَةِ، والذِّلَّةِ، والمَسْكَنَةِ، وأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الفَقْرِ، والكُفْرِ، والفُسُوقِ، والشِّقاقِ، والنِّفاقِ، والسُّمْعَةِ، والرِّياءِ، وأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الصَّمَمِ، والبَكَمِ، والجُنُونِ، والجُذامِ، والبَرَصِ، وَسَيِّىءِ الأَسْقامِ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a’udhu bika minal’ajzi wal kasali wal-jubni wal bukhl wal harami wal qaswati wal ghaflati wal’aylat wadh-dhillat wal maskanati wa a’uudhu bikaminal faqri wal kufri wal fusuuqi wash-shiqaaqi wan nifaaqi was-sum’ati war-riyaai wa a’uudhu bika minas-samami wal bakami wal junuuni wal judhaami wal barasi wasay-yyiil-asqaami
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from Inability/ Weakness; Laziness/lethargy; Cowardice, Miserliness, Senility, Hard heartedness, Heedlessness, Deprivation/destitution; Humiliation/Disgrace, Poverty/misery; And I seek refuge in You from absolute poverty, Disbelief, Rebellion/iniquity; Dissension, Hypocrisy, Seeking fame, And showing off, And I seek refuge in You from deafness, Being mute, Insanity/madness; Leprosy, Leukederma, And from any bad illness.
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al-Hakim 1/530 (1944), narrated by Anas, Al-Jame Al-Sagheer 01/217and Irwa’ al-Ghalil No. 852, al-Bayhaqi 1/459, Ibn Hibban in his Sahih 3/300 (with a additional wording of والشِّرْك), and see: Sahih al-Zaman, 2/456, no 2072

duas.subtitle: Refuge from poverty, humiliation, from wronging others or being wronged #1
duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ إنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْفَقْرِ، وَالْقِلَّةِ، وَالذِّلَّةِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ أَنْ أَظْلِمَ أو أُظْلَمَ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a’udhu bika minal faqri wal qillati wadh-dhillati wa a’udhu bika min an adhlima aw udhlam
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from want, poverty and humiliation, and I seek refuge with You from wronging others or being wronged
duas.en_reference: Reference: Narrated by Abu Dawood No. 1544, an-Nasai No. 5475, and in Al-Kubra, 4/451, No. 7438, Mustadrak Hakim, 1/531, Ahmad, 13 / 418, 8053, and al-Bayhaqi, 7/12, and classed as saheeh by al-Albaani in Saheeh Abi Dawood, 5/269, and Sahih Ibn Majah, no. 3099

duas.subtitle: Refuge from poverty, humiliation, from wronging others or being wronged #2
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبُخْلِ، وَالْجُبْنِ، وَسُوءِ الْعُمُرِ، وَفِتْنَةِ الصَّدْرِ، وَعَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a’udhu bika minal-buhkli, wal-jubni, wa suw’il- ‘umuri, wa fitnatis-sadri wa’ adhabil-qabr
duas.en_translation: O Allah! I seek refuge with You from stinginess, cowardice, the worst way of living, the trials inside the chest (heart) (i.e. envy, rancor, or false belief) and the torment of the grave
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sunan an-Nasa’i 5469, Abu Dawood 1539, Ibn Hibban, 3/300 No 1024 and Bazzar 1/ 455. Classed as Hasan (Good) by al-Arna’oot in Jami al-Usool 4/363 and said regarding the narration of Sahih Ibn Hibban “Sahih isnad on the conditions of Muslim”, and al-Albani in Talikat alhasan 3/1073 (Sahih lighayrihi)

duas.subtitle: Refuge from poverty, humiliation, from wronging others or being wronged #3
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ البُخْلِ، وَأَعوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الجُبْنِ، وَأعُوذُ بِكَ أنْ أُرَدَّ إِلَى أَرْذَلِ العُمُرِ، وَأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الدُّنْيَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a’udhu bika minal-Jubni wa a’udhu bika minal-Bukhli wa a’udhu bika min an Uradda ilā ardhalil-’Umur wa a’udhu bika min Fitnatid-Dunya wa ‘Adhābil-Qabr
duas.en_translation: O Allah! Verily, I seek refuge in You from al-Jubn (cowardice), and I seek refuge in You from al-Bukhl (stinginess), and I seek refuge in You from being returned to senility, and I seek refuge in You from Fitnatid-Dunya (the trials of this world) and ‘Adhābil-Qabr (the punishment of the grave).
duas.en_reference: Reference: al-Bukhari, no. 6374

duas.subtitle: Refuge from poverty, humiliation, from wronging others or being wronged #4
duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِعِزَّتِكَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، الَّذِي لاَ يَمُوتُ وَالْجِنُّ وَالإِنْسُ يَمُوتُونَ
duas.transliteration: A’oodhu bi izzatika alladhee laa ilaaha illa Anta, alladhee laa yamootu wal jinnu wal insu yamootoon
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge (with You) by Your Izzat (Honour, Power and Glory) Laa ilaaha illa Anta, (none has the right to be worshipped but You), Who does not die while the jinns and the human beings die
duas.en_reference: Reference: Sahih al-Bukhari 7383 (Book 97, Hadith 13)

duas.subtitle: Protection against Diseases - 1
duas.ar_dua: اللهم إني أعوذ بك من البرص والجنون، والجذام، وسيئ الأسقام
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a ‘udhu bika min al-barasi wa’l-jununi wa’l-judhami wa min sayyi’il-asqam
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with you from leprosy, and from insanity, and from paralysis, and from evil diseases
duas.en_reference: Reference: Narrated by Ahmad (12592), Abu Dawud (1554) and an-Nasai; classed as sahih by al-Albani

duas.subtitle: Protection against Diseases - 2
duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ ربَّ النَّاسِ ، أَذْهِب الْبَأسَ ، واشْفِ ، أَنْتَ الشَّافي لا شِفَاءَ إِلاَّ شِفَاؤُكَ ، شِفاءً لا يُغَادِرُ سقَماً
duas.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabban-naas, adhhibil-ba’s, washfi antash-Shaafi laa shifaa’a illaa shifaa’uka shifaa’an laa yughaadiru saqaman
duas.en_translation: O Allaah, Lord of mankind, do away with my suffering. Heal (me) as You are the only Healer and there is no cure except that of Yours, it is that which leaves no ailment behind
duas.en_reference: Reference: Al Bukhari (with Al-Fath 10/206) and Muslim 4/1721.

duas.subtitle: Protection against Diseases - 3
duas.ar_dua: أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ الْعَظِيمَ رَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ أَنْ يَشْفِيَكَ
duas.transliteration: As’alUllahal-‘adheema Rabbal-‘arshil-‘adhimi, an yashfiyaka
duas.en_translation: I beseech Allah the Great, the Rab of the Great Throne, to heal you
duas.en_reference: Reference: Abu Dawood, at-Tirmidhi

duas.subtitle: Protection against Diseases - 4
duas.ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ أَرْقِيكَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ يُؤْذِيكَ مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ نَفْسٍ أَوْ عَيْنٍ أَوْ حَاسِدٍ اللَّهُ يَشْفِيكَ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ أَرْقِيكَ
duas.transliteration: Bismillahi arqika, min kulli shay’in yu’dhika, min sharri kulli nafsin aw ‘aynin aw hasidin. Allahu yashfika, bismillahi arqika
duas.en_translation: In the Name of Allah I perform Ruqyah for you, from everything that is harming you, from the evil of every soul or envious eye, may Allah heal you. In the Name of Allah I perform Ruqyah for you
duas.en_reference:
Reference: Sunan Ibn Maaja 3523

It was narrated from Abu Sa’eed that Jibra’il came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said: “O Muhammad, you are ill. He said: ‘Yes.’ He then recited these words.

duas.subtitle: Dua for Parents #1
duas.ar_dua: رَّبِّ ٱرْحَمْهُمَا كَمَا رَبَّيَانِى صَغِيرًۭا
duas.transliteration: Rabbir Hamhuma Kama Rabbayani Sagheera
duas.en_translation: My Lord! Bestow on them Your Mercy as they did bring me up when I was young
duas.en_reference: Qur’an - Surah Al-Isra - 17:24

duas.subtitle: Dua for Parents #2
duas.ar_dua: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الْحِسَابُ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana-ghfirlī wa liwālidayya wa lilmu'minīna yauma yaqūmul-hisāb
duas.en_translation: Our Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and the believers on the Day when the judgment will come to pass.
duas.en_reference: Qur’an - Surah Ibrahim - 14:41

duas.subtitle: Dua for Parents #3
duas.ar_dua: رَّبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbi-ghfirlī wa liwālidayya wa liman dakhola baytī mu'minan wa-lilmu'minīna wal-mu'mināt
duas.en_translation: My Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and whoever enters my house in faith, and all believing men and women
duas.en_reference: Qur’an - Surah Nuh - 71:28

duas.subtitle: Dua for Parents #4
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Rabbi awzi'nī an asykura ni'matakal-latī an'amta 'alayya wa 'ala wālidayya wa an a'mala salihan tardhāhu wa adkhilnī birahmatika fī 'ibādikas-soliheen
duas.en_translation: My Lord, inspire me to (always) be thankful for the blessings You have granted me and my parents, and to do good deeds that please You; admit me by Your grace into the ranks of Your righteous servants
duas.en_reference: Qur'an - Surah An-Naml - 27:19

duas.subtitle: Dua for Parents #5
duas.ar_dua: رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِىٓ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَىَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا تَرْضَىٰهُ وَأَصْلِحْ لِى فِى ذُرِّيَّتِىٓ ۖ إِنِّى تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَإِنِّى مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ ١٥
duas.transliteration: rabbiawziAAnee an ashkura niAAmataka allatee anAAamta AAalayya waAAalawalidayya waan aAAmala salihan tardahuwaaslih lee fee thurriyyatee innee tubtuilayka wa-innee mina almuslimeen
duas.en_translation: My Lord! Grant me the power and ability that I may be grateful for Your Favour which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may do righteous good deeds, such as please You, and make my offspring good. Truly, I have turned to You in repentance, and truly, I am one of the Muslims (submitting to Your Will)
duas.en_reference: Qur'an - Surah Al Ahqaf - 46:15
